materials: Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Carrot Orange (12002) or 2 2  3 balls
Pixie Pink (12008) or 237 yds/216 m             237 yds/216 m             385 yds/352 m
Pow Purple (12007)
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
1 stitch marker
measurements: Small: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] in diameter, 6" [15 cm] high. Medium: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] in diameter, 7" [18 cm] high. Large: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] in diameter, 8" [20.5 cm] high.
gauge: 7 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands held together.
instructions: The instructions are written for smallest size. If changes are necessary for larger size(s) the instructions will be written thus ( ). Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc. With 2 strands held tog, ch 2. 1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 3 sc in each sc around. Join. 24 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc. Sizes Medium and Large only: 6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc. 7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 84 sc. Size Large only: 8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 96 sc. 9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 108 sc. All sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd. GAUGE: 7 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands held together. Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 5 (6-8)" [12.5 (15-20.5) cm]. Do not fasten off. Next rnd (Handle openings): Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 (17-22) sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 (6-8) sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 24 (34-44) sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 (6-8) sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch-1 sp around. Join. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off. Handles: With 2 strands tog, ch 18 (22-26). Thread chain in through 1st ch-1 sp of Handle opening rnd and back out through 2nd ch-1 sp of same rnd. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around, rotating chain through Handle opening for ease of working. Join. Fasten off. Rep for second Handle.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ Tweeds™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 316 yds/289 m) Main Color (MC) Midnight White (11001) 1 ball or 215 yds/197 m
Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ Tweeds™ (2.8 oz/80 g; 84 yds/77 m) Contrast A Chocolate Tweed (39002) 1 ball or 33 yds/30 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 stitch markers.
Tapestry needle.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 8" [20.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Basket is worked in the rnd with Handles added in finishing.
• Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
6th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. 42 sts.
8th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
9th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. 54 sts.
10th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * around. 60 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not fasten off. PM at beg of next rnd.
Cont with Side as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around.
2nd rnd: 1 splsc in each st around.
Rep last rnd until Side from marked rnd measures 8" [20.5 cm]. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
Handles (make 2)
With A, ch 49.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 48 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Attach Handles: With A and needle, sew first Handle to Basket (as shown in diagram) being careful not to twist Handle. Attach second Handle in same manner directly opposite first Handle.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453.6 g; 812 yds/742 m)
Contrast A Soft Grey Mix (10616) 1 ball
Contrast B Dark Grey Mix (10618) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] in diameter at base, 15" [38 cm] in diameter at top and 11" [28 cm] tall.
gauge: 10 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] holding 2 strands together.
instructions:
Note: Basket is worked with 2 strands of yarn held tog throughout.
Base: With 1 strand of A and 1 strand of B held tog, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
9th to 14th rnds: Cont as established, increasing 8 sc evenly around each rnd. 112 sc at end of 14th rnd.
15th rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). Dcbp around each sc around. Join with sl st to first dcbp.
Note: From this point on, work side of Basket joining and turning work at end of each rnd.
Next 16 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 26 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 27 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 116 sc. Turn.
Next 12 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Make handles: Next rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 50 sc. Ch 8. Skip next 8 sc. 1 sc in each of next 50 sc. Ch 8. Skip next 8 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 8 sc in first ch-8 sp. 1 sc in each of next 50 sc. 8 sc in next ch-8 sp. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 116 sc. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
Rep last rnd twice more.
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket Calico™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Driftwood Dreams (04924) 2 balls or 376 yds/344 m
Contrast B Ocean Waves (04932) 2 balls or 376 yds/344 m
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® stitch marker
Susan Bates® yarn needle
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] diameter x 9½" [24.5 cm] high.
gauge: 7 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc
BASKET
Beg at Base, with 1 strand each of A and B held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc. 
Cont in this manner, inc 8 sc evenly around next 5 rnds (as established). 104 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 9" [23 cm].
Next rnd (Handle openings): Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 42 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch-1 sp around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
Handles: With 1 strand each of A and B held tog, ch 26. Thread chain through first ch-1 sp of Handle opening rnd and back out through second ch-1 sp of same rnd. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around, rotating chain through Handle opening for ease of working. Join. Fasten off.
Rep for second Handle.

materials:
RED HEART Super Saver®:
Small:  2 skeins of each 334 Buff A and 313 Aran B
Large: 4 Skeins 341 Light Grey A and 2 skeins of 313 Aran B

Susan Bates® Crochet Hook:
6.5mm [US K-10½]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A and B = Color A and Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Small basket measures about 8" [20.5 cm] tall and 30" [76 cm] circumference. Large basket measures about 12" [30.5 cm] and 42" [106.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: 8 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 9½ rounds = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet with 3 strands of yarn held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BASKET
Base
With 3 strands of A held together, ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—54 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc.
Large Basket Only:
Round 11: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—66 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 11 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—78 sc.
Round 14: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 12 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—84 sc.
Sides
All Baskets:
Next Round (right side): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—60 (84) sc.
Next 5 (19) Rounds: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Change yarn color to B in joining slip st of last round.
Next Round (right side): With B, ch 1, sc in same st as joining, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Next 10 (6) Rounds: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Handles
Next Round: Ch 1, sc in first 10 (14) sts, ch 10 (14), skip next 10 (14) sts, sc in next 20 (28) sts, ch 10 (14) sts, skip next 10 (14) sts, sc in last 10 (14) sts; join with slip st in first sc—40 (56) sc and 2 ch-10 (14) spaces.
Next Round: Ch 1, [sc in each st to next ch-space, 10 (14) sc in ch-space] twice, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Last Round: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off B.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Main Color (MC) Lemon Lime (04223) 4 balls or 777 yds/711 m
Contrast A White (04005) 1 ball or 21 yds/19 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
Stitch marker.
Fiber Fill Stuffing.
abbreviations: Sc2(4)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (4) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] diameter x 20" [51 cm] tall, excluding Tail and Toes.
gauge: 7.5 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions:
BASE 
Note: Join each rnd with sl st to first sc.
With 2 strands of MC held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 12" [30.5 cm]. On last rnd, place marker on 54th st to mark beg of Dome. Place markers on 28th, 35th and 42nd sts to mark tooth placement. Fasten off.
DOMED OPENING
With RS facing, join 2 strands of MC with sl st to marker indicating 54th st of rnd.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 35 sts. Turn. 36 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Turn. 32 sc.
3rd and alt RS rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) twice. Turn. 28 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 4 times. Turn. 24 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Turn. 20 sc.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Turn. 16 sc.
12th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 12 sc.
14th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) twice. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Turn. 8 sc.
15th row: (RS). Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. Turn. 4 sc.
16th row: Ch 1. Sc4tog. Turn.
Edging rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly down edge of Dome to last st on Dome. Work sc2tog over last st of Dome and first st of Basket opening. Work sc evenly across Basket opening to last st on opening. Work sc2tog over last st of Basket opening and first st of Dome. Work sc evenly up rem sts on Dome. Do not fasten off.
Finish with invisible join: Cut MC, leaving a long yarn tail. Pull loop on hook up until tail passes through last st (no loops rem on hook). Thread yarn tail onto yarn needle. Insert needle under top 2 loops of next st from front to back. Insert needle through back loop only of last st worked, from front to back. Pull gently to close gap and make yarn tail look like st.
TAIL
Note: Tail is worked in spiral. Do not join rnds. Place marker on first st to mark beg of rnd, moving marker up each rnd.
With 2 strands of MC, ch 20. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. 20 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 16 sc.
5th to 7th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 12 sc.
9th to 11th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
12th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 8 sc.
13th rnd: *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 4 sc. Fasten off, leaving long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
SPIKES (make 3)
With 2 strands of MC, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn. 1 sc.
Edging rnd: Ch 1. Work sc evenly around edges of Spikes, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving long end.
TOES
Note: There is a ch-4 between 2 sets of 3 Toes.
1st row: (RS). With 1 strand of MC, **ch 5. Working into back bumps of ch, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch** — Toe made. Rep from ** to ** twice more. Ch 4. Rep from ** to ** 3 times. Do not turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Work sc evenly along straight edge (sides of dc sts) of 3 Toes. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Work sc evenly along straight edge of rem 3 Toes. Fasten off, leaving long end.
HANDS (make 2)
With 1 strand of MC, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). Working into back bumps of chain, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of last 2 ch. Fasten off, leaving long end.
TEETH
Bottom Teeth: **With RS facing, join 2 strands of A with sl st along Basket opening at sc above first marker (28th st).
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.**
Rep from ** to ** at sc above rem markers (35th st and 42nd st).
Top Teeth: Rep from ** to ** along Domed edge twice, centering placement of each Tooth between Bottom Teeth (see picture).
FINISHING
Stuff Tail. Sew Tail, Spikes, Toes and Hands to Basket, as shown in picture.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast A Soft Ecru (01004) 6 balls or 720 yds [654 m]
Contrast B Dazzle Blue (01131) 2 balls or 135 yds [123 m]
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] high.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] holding 2 strands of yarn together.
instructions:
Base: With 2 strands of A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th to 15th rnds: Cont in this manner, inc 6 sc evenly around each rnd. 90 sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc.
17th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Rep from * around to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 94 sc.
Place marker at end of last rnd.
Main Section: Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 94 hdc.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 9½" [24.5 cm]. Join 2 strands of B at end of last rnd. Break A.
With 2 strands of B, rep last rnd 3 times more.
Make handles: Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 6 times. *Ch 18. Skip next 18 sps between 2 hdc.* (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 29 times. Rep from * to * once more. **1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from ** around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 6 times. Work 18 hdc in next ch-18 sp. (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 29 times. Work 18 hdc in next ch-18 sp. *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 94 hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit™ Set includes 12 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 600 g/21 oz total), yardage (85 m/93 yds each; 1020 m/1116 yds total)
VERSION 1: Contrast A Royal 1 ball or 42 yds/38 m
Contrast B Shocking Pink 1 ball or 23 yds/21 m
Contrast C Cherry Red 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Contrast D Lavender 1 ball or 27 yds/25 m
VERSION 2: Contrast A Grey Heather 1 ball or 42 yds/38 m
Contrast B Soft White 1 ball or 23 yds/21 m
Contrast C Black 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Contrast D Café Latte 1 ball or 27 yds/25 m
Size U.S. 7 [4.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] cube.
gauge: 14 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnd counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color, yoh with new color and proceed.

PLAIN MOTIF (make 3)
See diagram on page 2
With B, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 6. (3 dc in ring. Ch 3) 3 times. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-6. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join C with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-6. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join D with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-6. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join A with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 4 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 5 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

HEART MOTIF (make 2)
With B, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 6. (3 dc in ring. Ch 3) 3 times. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-6. 
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-6.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp, changing to A in last dc. With A, ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. With B, ch 1 to change color. With B, 3 dc in next ch-1 sp, changing to A in last dc. With A, ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. With B, ch 1 to change color. With B, (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp, changing to A in last dc. With A, ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break B.
4th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each of the next 2 dc. 5 dc in next ch-3 sp. *(1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. ** 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 5 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-3. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

HANDLES (make 2)
With D, ch 32, leaving a long end to attach to Basket.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 28 ch. 30 dc. Fasten off leaving a long end to attach to Basket.

Assembly
Place 2 Plain Motifs WS tog. With A, sl st across edge of both Motifs to join. Rep with 3rd Plain Motif to create a strip (see diagram). Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Place Heart Motif WS tog onto center Plain Motif, Heart point up and bumps down. With A, sl st across edge of both squares to join. Rep for 2nd Heart Motif on opposite side. (Note direction of Motifs on diagram) . Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Fold up 4 outer Motifs tog and sl st along sides to form Basket. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Using long ends on Handles, sl st to top edge of 2 Plain Motifs, beg at first dc after ch-3 sp. Fasten off and weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ O’Go™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Milk and Honey (42005) 1 O’Go
Rose Gold (42019) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
Splhdc = Split half double crochet: work hdc between ‘legs’ at front and back of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops. Stitches should appear as “V”s on RS and WS of work.
Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] diameter x 10½" [26.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 7 splsc and 8.5 rounds = 4" [10 cm]. 7 splhdc and 7 rounds = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
BASKET
Notes: 
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use.
• Designate each color A, B, C, D, E, F as indicated in Materials. 
Base Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of each subsequent rnd for easier counting.
Wth B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
Cont working in spiral as follows:
2nd rnd: 2 splsc in each sc around. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in next st. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
4th rnd: *1 splsc in next st. 2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in next st. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
5th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
6th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 2 sts. 2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
7th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. 42 sts.
8th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 3 sts. 2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
9th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. 54 sts.
10th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 4 sts. 2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. 60 sts.
11th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * around. 66 sts.
12th rnd: 1 splsc in each st around.
13th rnd: *1 splsc in each of next 5 sts. 2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. 72 sts.
14th rnd: 1 splsc in each st around. With F, join with sl st to first st. Break B.
Do not fasten off.
Cont with Sides as follows:
Side Note: Rnds are joined with sl st to first st.
1st rnd: With F, ch 1. 1 hdcbl in each st around. Join. 72 sts.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 splhdc in each st around. Join. 72 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 splhdc in each st around. Join with A.
Fasten off.
Proceed with Intarsia Pat as follows:
Notes:
• Turn after each rnd, working odd rnds with RS facing and even rnds with WS facing.
• Use separate balls of yarn for each area of color in the design (as shown in Diagram on page 3). When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Pick up new color from under old color at WS of work to lock colors in to avoid a hole. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed in new color, leaving old color at WS of work.
• Chart is shown on page 3.
Beg working Chart in splhdc, reading RS rnds from right to left and WS rnds from left to right, noting 12-st rep will be worked 6 times, until 13th rnd of Chart is complete as follows:
1st rnd: (RS). With appropriate color, ch 1 (does not count as st). Working from Chart using appropriate color, rep 12-st rep 6 times total, 1 splhdc in each st around. Join. Turn. 72 sts.
2nd rnd: (WS). With appropriate color, ch 1 (does not count as st). 1 splhdc in same first st. Working from Chart using appropriate color, rep 12-st rep 6 times total, 1 splhdc in each st around. Join. Turn.
Keeping cont of chart, rep last 2 rnds until 13th rnd of Chart is complete, ending on a RS rnd.
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Mega BulkyTM (10.5 oz/300 g; 64 yds/58 m) - Small Version: Linen (88021) 3 balls - Medium Version: New Gold (88609) 5 balls - Large Version: Teal (88206) 6 balls
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
measurements: Small: Approx 11” [28 cm] diameter x 12” [30.5 cm] high. Medium: Approx 13½” [34.5 cm] diameter x 14” [35.5 cm] high. Large: Approx 15” [38 cm] diameter x 16” [40.5 cm] high.
gauge: 6 sc and 6 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions: Ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 18 sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 24 sc. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 30 sc. 6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 36 sc. 7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 42 sc. 8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 48 sc. Medium and Large Versions only: 9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 54 sc. 10th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 60 sc. Large Version only: 11th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 66 sc. 12th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 72 sc. All Versions: Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Place marker at end of rnd. Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 10 (12-14)” [ 25.5 (30.5-35.5) cm]. Do not fasten off. Handles: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 (12-15) sc. Ch 6. Skip next 6 sc.1 sc in each of next 18 (24-30) sc. Ch 6. Skip next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 (12-15) sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 (12-15) sc. 10 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in each of next 18 (24-30) sc. 10 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in each of next 9 (12-15) sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off. 56 (68-80) sc.

materials: Bernat® Beyond® (4.2 oz/120 g; 80 yds/73 m)
Main Color (MC) Smoke (23027) 2 balls
Contrast A Slate (23003) 1 ball
Contrast B Cream (23004) 1 ball
Contrast C Emerald Green (23013) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stuffing.
12 mm safety eyes.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] tall (sitting) and 8" [20.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Basket
With C, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th to 17th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
18th rnd: Sl st in each sc around (to give Basket a more defined edge). Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Koala
Nose 
With A, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working on opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving long end.
Head 
With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 24 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 16 sts.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Sew on Nose. Attach safety eyes, following manufacturer’s instructions. Stuff firmly.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 12 sts.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Stuff rem of Head. Weave yarn through front loops of last rnd. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Ear (make 2)
With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
4th to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Inner Ear (make 2) 
With B, ch 3. 
1st row: (RS). 6 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Do not join. Fasten off. 
Lay Ear flat. Sew Inner Ear to Ear as shown in picture. 
Sew Ears onto Head between 5th and 9th rnds of Head.
Body
With MC, ch 6. 
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Working on opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in first ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
4th to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sts.
9th to 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sts.
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Stuff Body firmly.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Weave yarn through front loops of last rnd. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Legs (make 2) 
With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog.  1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 9 sts. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Join with sl st to first st.  7 sts. 
7th to 14th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
Stuff Legs lightly.
Arms (make 2)
With MC, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.  
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Do not join. 
Cont in rnds as follows:
2nd to 7th rnds: 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Do not join.
8th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. 8 sts. 
9th to 14th rnds: 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Do not join. Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving a long end.
Do not stuff Arms.
Sew Body to Basket (make sure bottom lays flat along side Basket). 
Tip: Sew Body over seam of Basket to hide seam!
Sew Head to top of Body and rim of Basket (make sure Head is secure and not floppy).
Sew on Arms and Legs to Body, then to Basket.

materials: RED HEART® Celebration™: 1 ball each 9840 Blue/Silver A, 9740 Pink/Silver B, and 9240 Lime/Silver C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [J-10 US]
Yarn needle
ten ¾” (19 mm) jingle bells
size 10 steel hook (to attach bells)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Basket measures 7” tall x 8” diameter across bottom (18 x 20.5 cm)
gauge: Rounds 1–4 = 3½” (9 cm) in pattern. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With 3 strands of A held together, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around—16 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—32 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 10 times; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc.
Rounds 9–13: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
With 3 strands of B held together, draw up a loop in 31st sc of Round 13.
Round 14: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 15: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *skip next sc, sm shell in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * to last 3 st, skip next sc, sm shell in next sc, skip last sc; join with slip st in first sc—15 sm shells and 15 sc.
Round 16: Ch 3 (counts as first dc of first sm shell), 2 dc in same sc as joining (first sm shell made), *sc in 2nd dc of next sm shell, sm shell in next sc; repeat from * to last sm shell, sc in 2nd dc of last sm shell; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Round 17: Slip st in next dc, ch 1, sc in same dc, *sm shell in next sc, sc in 2nd dc of next sm shell; repeat from * to last sc, sm shell in last sc; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 18: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), *hdc in next dc, sc in next dc, hdc in next dc, dc in next sc; repeat from * to last sm shell, hdc in next dc, sc in next dc, hdc in next dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—15 dc, 30 hdc, and 15 sc.
Round 19: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc. Fasten off.
With 3 strands of C held together, draw up a loop in 31st sc of Round 19.
Round 20: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 21: Repeat Round 20; join with slip st in first sc. Drop 2 strands of C to wrong side. Note: Work next round loosely with one strand of C.
Round 22: Bell sc (see Special Stitches) in first sc, sc in next 5 sc, *bell sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc; repeat from * around; pick up 2 strands of C and join with slip st in first sc—10 bells added.
Round 23: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 24: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *skip next 2 sc, lg shell in next sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * to last 5 sc, skip next 2 sc, lg shell in next sc, skip next 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc—10 lg shells and 10 sc.
Round 25: *Ch 3, (slip st, ch 3, slip st) in 3rd dc of lg shell, ch 3, slip st in next sc; repeat from * to last lg shell, ch 3, (slip st, ch 3, slip st) in 3rd dc of lg shell, ch 3; join with slip st in first ch of beginning ch-3. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 ball 301 Mirage for Tall Keeper; 1 ball each 334 Buff A and 301 Mirage B for Short Keeper.
Crochet Hook: 5 mm [US H-8].
Yarn needle, stitch marker, 2-3 oatmeal containers, glue.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Tall Keeper is 10” tall. Short Keeper is 5” tall.
gauge: 25 sc = 8”; 16 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Notes: Keepers are crocheted in a spiral fashion in continuous rounds. Mark beginning of round. To change colors, work last step of previous st with new color. To prevent colors pooling on variegated yarn, divide yarn into 2 balls. Alternate working with each ball every round, carrying ball not in use loosely along wrong side of work.
Special Abbreviations
sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
TALL KEEPER
Bottom Piece
Round 1: Ch 2, 6 sc in the 2nd ch from hook – 6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 6: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 7: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times – 42 sc.
Round 8: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 6 times – 48 sc.
Round 9: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] 6 times – 54 sc.
Round 10: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts] 6 times – 60 sc, slip in first sc to join.
Sides
Round 11: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around, slip st in first st to join – 60 sc.
Rounds 12-13: Working in continuous rounds, sc in each sc around – 60 sc.
Round 14: [Sc2tog, sc in next 8 sts] 6 times – 54 sc.
Repeat Round 12 on 54 sc until Sides measure 9½” from Round 11.
Top Edging
Working in back loops only, slip st in each st around for 3 rounds.
Fasten off.
Lid
Round 1: Ch 2, 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in first sc to join – 6 sc.
Round 2: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around, slip st in first st to join – 6 sc.
Work in continuous rounds until Stem measures 2” from beginning.
Repeat Rounds 2-13 as for Bottom Piece – 60 sc.
Repeat Round 12 on 60 sc until piece measures ½” from Round 11.
Repeat Top Edging as for Bottom Piece.
Fasten off.
SHORT KEEPER
With A, work Rounds 1-14 of Bottom Piece same as for Tall Keeper.
Repeating Round 12, work stripes with 2 rounds of B as desired until Sides measures 4½” from Round 11.
Work Top Edging as for Tall Keeper with A.
Work Lid as for Tall Keeper with A, adding 2 rounds of B for stripe.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Patchwork™ (10.5 oz/300 g, 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Pastry Cream (47002) 3 balls or 534 yds/485 m
Contrast B Ocean Waves (47015) 4 balls or 693 yds/630 m
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® stitch marker
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] diameter x 19" [48 cm] high unfolded and excluding fringe.
gauge: 7 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions:
Note: Do not join at end of rnds, unless otherwise stated. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker up for beg of each rnd. With 1 strand each of A and B tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. PM on first st for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from* around. 32 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc.
6th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 56 sc.
8th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. 64 sc.
Cont in this manner, inc 8 sc evenly around until work measures 17" [43 cm] diameter. Join at end of last rnd.

Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 scbl in each sc around. Join. PM at end of rnd. Break A. Join 2nd strand of B.
Next rnd: With 2 strands of B, working into both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Do not join. PM on first st for beg of rnd. Work in spiral in continuous rnds.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 10" [25.5 cm]. Break 2 strands of B. Join 2 strands of A and rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 19" [48 cm]. Sl st to next sc. Fasten off.
Fold top of Basket down 5" [12.5 cm] to RS.
Twisted Fringe: Holding folded edge upside down, with RS facing, join single strand of B with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. *Draw up a loop 8" [20.5 cm] long. Twist loop 30 times. Sl st in same st, allowing twisted loop to coil around itself. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m; Ombres: 2 oz/57g, 95 yds/86 m)
Contrast A Yellow (00010) 2 balls or 220 yds/200 m
Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball or 95 yds/86 m
Contrast A Hot Blue (01742) 2 balls or 220 yds/200 m
Contrast B Swimming Pool Ombre (02744) 1 ball or 95 yds/86 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® steel yarn needle.
abbreviations: Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
measurements: Approx 7½" [19 cm] diameter x 4 [10 cm] high (with cuff).
gauge: 11.5 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held tog in Body Pat.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
With 2 strands of A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
10th rnd (ridge): Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Proceed in Body Pat as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 splsc in each st around. Join.
Rep last rnd for Body Pat until Basket from ridge rnd measures 3" [7.5 cm], joining 2 strands of B at end of last rnd. Turn. Break A.
Edging: 1st rnd: (WS). With 2 strands of B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join. Turn.
2nd rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join. Turn.
Rep last 2 rnds twice more, then 1st rnd once (7 rnds of Edging in total).
Fasten off. Fold Edging to RS of Basket.
Handles (make 2): Cut 8 lengths of B 10" [25.5 cm] long.
Work around 4 strands of B for each Handle as follows:
With 2 strands of B, sl st around 4 strands (leaving approx 3" [7.5 cm] end). Work 14 sc tightly around 4 strands, leaving approx 3" [7.5 cm] free at opposite end.
Using yarn ends sew Handles securely to top edge of Basket (inside folded edge as shown).

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ O’Go™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Art Nouveau (42022) 3 O’Gos
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ at front and back of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops.
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] diameter x 9" [23 cm] high, excluding handles.
gauge: 7 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held together.
instructions:
Notes: 
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet. 
• Pull tie to remove. 

CROCHET I SKILL LEVEL: EASY

BASKET
Base: Working from 2 O’Gos (see note above), with 1 strand each of A and C held together, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 sc. Join 2 strands of B. Break A and C.

Next rnd: With B, ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. PM at end of rnd. 

Side: Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc) 4 times. Join. 84 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 20 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 4 times. Join. 88 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc) 4 times. Join. 92 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with 2 strands of A. Break B.
Next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 splsc in each sc around. Join with 2 strands of C. Do not break A.
Next 3 rnds: With C, ch 1. *With C, 1 splsc in next st. With A, 1 splsc in next st. Rep from * around. Join.
Next 3 rnds: With A, ch 1. *With A, 1 splsc in next st. With C, 1 splsc in next st. Rep from * around. Join.
Rep last 6 rnds for approx 4" [10 cm], ending with 3 rnds of either pat rep. Break C at end of last rnd.
Next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 splsc in each sc around. Join with B. Break A.
Next 2 rnds: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Next rnd (Handle openings): With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 42 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch-1 sp around. Join C. Break B.
Next rnd: With C, ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Handles: (Make 2). Cut 1 strand of C 156" [396.5 cm] long. (Thread in through 1st ch-1 sp of Handle opening rnd and back out through 2nd ch-1 sp) 6 times. Adjust these 6 strands evenly. Tie ends together moving knot to top of Handle (knot will be covered with row of sc).
Fold Handle strands in half and join 2 strands of A at right side of Handle with sc.
1st row: Work in sc around all 12 strands to opposite end of Handle (enclosing knot). Fasten off.
Rep for 2nd Handle working through 3rd and 4th ch-1 sps.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton
Requires: 615 m/673 yds
OR 400 g ball: 1 ball
OR 42.5 g ball: 10 balls
Size 5.5 mm (U.S. I or 9) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit round basket approx 18" [45.5 cm] diameter x 16" [40.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st throughout. Join all rnds with sl st in first st.
Beg at bottom, ch 5. Join with sl st to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join. 8 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
Cont inc 8 sts every rnd evenly spaced (as before) until there are 168 hdc (approx 18" [45.5 cm] diameter).
Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Working in front loops only, 1 dc in each hdc around. Join. Place marker.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each dc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last 2 rnds until work from marker measures 16" [40.5 cm], ending with sc rnd.
Next rnd: (Openings for handles). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next sc. Ch 25. Miss next 24 sc. 1 dc in each of next 60 sc. Ch 25. Miss next 24 sc. 1 dc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st (working 1 sc in each ch) around. 170 sc. Join.
Proceed in Lace Pat as follows:
1st rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next 3 sc. (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next sc – shell made. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around; ending with 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Miss last sc. Join.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1). 1 hdc in same sp. *Ch 3. 1 sc in top of next Shell. Ch 3. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next ch-1 sp – v-st made. Rep from * around. Join to 2nd ch of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in same sp. *1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Shell in next V-st. Rep from * around; ending with 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Join to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 3. V-st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in top of next Shell. Rep from * around. Join to first sc.
5th rnd: Sl st back in last ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Shell in next V-st. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around; ending with Shell in last V-st. Join to first sc. Rep 2nd to 5th rnds for 4" [10 cm], ending with 3rd or 5th rnd. Fasten off.
Ties (make 8). Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. Sew 2 ties at each side of openings (see photo).

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Main Color (MC) Cream (06003) 1 ball
Contrast A Black (06004) 2 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Splhdc = Split half double crochet: work hdc between ‘legs’ at front and back of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops.
measurements: Approx 13¼" [33.5 cm] long x 12" [30.5 cm] wide x 9" [23 cm] tall.
gauge: 9.5 splhdc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pat.
instructions:
BASKET
Base
Note: Ch 1 at beg of row does not count as st.
With MC, ch 33.
1st row: 1 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 32 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 splhdc in each st across. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 12" [30.5 cm]. Do not fasten off.

Sides
Notes: Join all rnds with sl st to first st. Ch 1 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Beg working around Base in joined rnds as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each st across (total of 32 hdc). Working around edge sts of rows, work 28 hdc evenly along first side edge. Working in unused loops of foundation ch, 1 hdc in each rem ch across foundation edge (total of 32 hdc). Working around edge sts of rows, work 28 hdc evenly along second side edge. Join with sl st to first hdc. 120 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 splhdc in each st around. Join.

Beg working from Chart as follows:
Notes:
• When working from chart, carry color not in use loosely across top of row and work sts around it.
• Change colors by drawing new color through last 3 loops on hook and proceed with new color, keeping color change to WS of work.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first hdc.
• Ch 1 at beg of each rnd. Ch 1 does not count as st and is not shown on chart.

1st to 23rd rnds: Work rnds 1 to 23 of Chart, noting each square represents 1 splhdc, reading all rnds from right to left and noting 12-st rep will be worked 10 times. Break A.
Next 2 rnds: With MC, ch 1, 1 splhdc in each st around. Join.
Fasten off.

materials: 1 skein each 3955 Wildflower A and 358 Lavender B
1 ball 226 Natural of AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6]
Extra hooks in neighboring sizes
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
Two 10½ x 13½" (26.5 x 34.5 cm) sheets of 7-count plastic canvas
straight pins
yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Box Measures 9¼ x 9¼ x 3½" (23.5 x 23.5 x 9 cm)
gauge: 17 sts (including ch sts) = 4" (10 cm); 16 rows = 4" (10 cm) in Moss Stitch using smaller hook.
instructions:
MOSS STITCH
Ch an even number of sts.
Row 1: Skip 3 ch, sc in next ch, * ch 1, skip 1 foundation ch, sc in next ch; repeat from * to end, turn.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat Row 3 only for Moss st.
INSIDE BOTTOM
With A and smaller hook, ch through 1 full color sequence, with the last loop on hook being the first loop of a new color just after a color change in the yarn.
Row 1 (right side): Sk 3 ch, sc in the 4th ch from the hook, * ch 1, sc around the foundation ch (instead of going into a ch st); repeat from * until 1 full color sequence has been completed. Count the number of sc made in each individual color in the colorway and note it down, then unravel one st repeat (sc, ch 1). Leave remaining ch sts unworked, turn.
Row 2 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end finishing with a sc in last ch-3 space, turn.
Note: As you work this row and all remaining rows, you MUST get the correct number of sc in each color in order to maintain the planned color pooling. Change hook sizes, or actual st used, to get the correct color in place. If you use the same number of sts per color that you counted on Row 1, it will work out.
Row 3 (right side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Note: The color of the sts on this row will shift to the left or right by 1 st from the previous right side row depending on the colorway and if you are right or left handed. It doesn’t matter which direction the stitch shifts as long as it is offset by 1.
Row 4 (wrong side): Ch 2 (counts as a st now and throughout), sc in next ch-1 space, * ch 1, sc in next ch-1 space; repeat from * to end, finishing with a sc in last ch-2 space, turn.
Repeat rows 3 & 4 until 1 full color sequence has been worked at each side edge, ending after a Row 3.
Fasten off.
SIDES OF BOX
With A and smaller hook, ch through 4 full color sequences, with the last loop on hook being the first loop of a new color just after a color change in the yarn.
Row 1 (right side): Sk 3 ch, sc in the 4th ch from the hook, * ch 1, sc around the foundation ch (instead of going into a ch st); repeat from * until 4 full color sequences have been completed. Make certain that the number of sc made in each individual color in the colorway is the same as in Inside Bottom. Unravel one st repeat (sc, ch 1). Leave remaining ch sts unworked, turn.
Work in planned pooling Moss st same as Inside Bottom until piece measures 7" (18 cm), ending after a right side row. Fasten off.
OUTSIDE BOTTOM
With B and larger hook, ch 25.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end, turn – 24 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until piece measures same as Inside Bottom, ending after a right side row.
Fasten off.
PLASTIC CANVAS FRAME
Cut plastic canvas pieces as follows: One square wider than Inside Bottom piece by one plastic-grid on all sides (C), two rectangles wider than Inside Bottom by one plastic-grid x 3.25" (8cm) high (D), and two rectangles equal to side edge of Inside Bottom x 3.25" (8cm) high (E).
Using cotton crochet thread, whip st short edges of D rectangles to short edges of E rectangles to join sides of frame, being sure to pull the cotton tight after each st. Align D rectangles so they are on outside of seam, as shown in frame diagram.
Use markers to hold corners of C to corners where the sides meet.
Using cotton crochet thread, whip st around edges of C, securing it to the sides by pulling the cotton tight after each st.
FINISHING
Squish or stretch the sts on foundation ch of Inside Bottom piece to match the width of the rest of the piece. You can slide the sts around along the foundation ch, as with an adjustable ring. Unravel unused foundation ch sts and weave in yarn tail to secure foundation. Work foundation of Sides of Box piece the same.
With right sides facing together, pin top edge of Sides of Box piece to Inside Bottom piece. With B, whip st short edges of Sides together and continue sewing around perimeter of Inside Bottom. Pull the sts snug so they don’t show through on right side.
Place Inside Bottom into the plastic canvas frame with wrong side down, matching up each corner. Using yarn needle and B, pass needle from outside of plastic frame up through a corner. Make sure the corner is in place, and pass the needle from inside the box back through to the outside, catching one st to secure the corner. From outside the plastic frame, pull the two ends of B tightly and tie a knot. Cut off the ends of the yarn, leaving a short tail. Don’t worry about the tails, they will be covered by Outside Bottom piece. Secure remaining 3 corners and center of Inside Bottom the same.
Carefully fold the sides of the box down over the plastic frame, easing the piece around the corners to avoid tearing the yarn.
With right sides facing out, pin Outside Bottom to foundation edge of Sides. With B, whip st around Outside Bottom to join to Sides of Box.
Weave all loose ends to inside.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 97 yds/87 m) Crimson (27035) 3 balls
Size U.S. P/Q/19 (15 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Trfp = *(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in indicated space. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Repeat from * once more. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.

TrCl = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of last trfp worked at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next trfp at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] diameter x 14½ " [37 cm] high.
gauge: 4 sc and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 2. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as sc and ch-1). Skip next sc. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch. PM at end of rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as sc and ch-1). Skip first ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd ch.
11th rnd: (Foundation Cluster rnd). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. Tr2tog over first ch-1 sp 2 rnds below and next ch-1 sp 2 rnds below. Skip next sc (behind Tr2tog). 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *Tr2tog over last ch-1 sp worked 2 rnds below and next ch-1 sp 2 rnds below. Skip next sc (behind Tr2tog). 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Tr2tog over last ch-1 sp worked 2 rnds below and first ch-1 sp worked 2 rnds below. Skip next sc (behind Tr2tog). 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
12th and 13th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. TrCl over last TrCl and next TrCl. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *TrCl over last TrCl worked and next TrCl. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around, noting TrCl in last rep is worked over last TrCl worked and first TrCl worked. Join with sl st to first st.
15th and 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. TrCl over first TrCl and next TrCl. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *TrCl over last TrCl worked and next TrCl. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. TrCl over last TrCl worked and first TrCl. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep 12th to 17th rnds for pat until work from marked rnd measures approx 14" [35.5 cm], ending on 14th or 17th rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to top of first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/454 g; 812 yds/742 m)
Main Color (MC) Off White (10514) 1 ball
Contrast A Robins Egg (10648) 1 ball
Contrast B Dark Pink (10621) 1 ball
Contrast C Sunflower (10549) 1 ball
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] diameter x 11" [28 cm] tall.
gauge: 10 sts and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] in pattern with 2 strands of yarn held together.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch-2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
Base: With 2 strands of MC held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc. Do not fasten off. 
Shape sides in Pat as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, skip first sc. 1 hdc in next sc. Working in front of last hdc, 1 hdc in prev skipped sc. *Skip next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. Working in front of last hdc, 1 hdc in prev skipped sc. Rep from * around. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. Working in both loops, *Skip next st. 1 hdc in next st. Working in front of last hdc, 1 hdc in prev skipped st. Rep from * around. Join.
Rep last rnd for Pat until work from last rnd of Base measures 8½" [21.5 cm].
Handles: Next rnd: Ch 2. [Skip next st. 1 hdc in next st. Working in front of last hdc, 1 hdc in prev skipped st]. 6 times. Ch 12. Skip next 12 sts [Skip next st. 1 hdc in next st. Working in front of last hdc, 1 hdc in prev skipped st]. 12 times. Ch 12. Skip next 12 sts [Skip next st. 1 hdc in next st. Working in front of last hdc, 1 hdc in prev skipped st] 6 times. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 2. Working in all sts as well as into all ch, *Skip next st. 1 hdc in next st. Working in front of last hdc, 1 hdc in prev skipped st. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 2. *Skip next st. 1 hdc in next st. Working in front of last hdc, 1 hdc in prev skipped st. Rep from * around. Join.
Fasten off.
Pompoms (make 5 each with A, B and C)
Wind yarn around 2 fingers approx 30 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center with length of yarn approx 12" [30.5 cm] long. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape, being careful not to cut center tie strands. Using center tie strands, attach Pompoms to Basket in random placement as shown in photo or as desired.

pattern_name: Crochet One & Done Hanging Basket Trio
materials: Bernat® Blanket™ O’Go™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Art Nouveau (42022) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. K/10 ½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] diameter x 7½" [19 cm] tall, unfolded and excluding Handle.
gauge: 8 sc and 8 rnds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet. 
• Pull tie to remove. 
• Colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use.
• Designate each color A, B, and C as indicated in shade palette.
• Start crocheting!
• Do not join at ends of rnds. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.

Basket (Make 1 each A, B, and C)
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
Cont working in spiral as follows:
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
7th to 19th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
20th rnd: Ch 8. Skip each of first 6 sc – Handle made. Being careful not to twist chain, 1 sc in each of last 30 sc. 
21st rnd: 1 sc in each of first 8 ch. 1 sc in each of last 30 sc. 38 sc.
Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
Hang Basket from Handle, folding upper 2" [5 cm] of front edge of basket down (as shown in photo).

materials: Bernat® Plush Big™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 45 yds/41 m) Leafy Green (63022) 4 balls or 160 yds/145 m
Size U.S. Q (16 mm) Susan Bates® Luxite crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] diameter x 13½" [34.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 4 hdc and 3 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 1 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
All rnds are worked beg in first st.
All rnds are joined with sl st to first hdc.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdc in next st. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row on WS of work (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram). Rep from * around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
8th to 13th rnds: Rep 6th and 7th rnds 3 times more.
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. Ch 7 for handle. Skip next 5 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 15 hdc. Ch 7 for handle. Skip next 5 hdc. 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
15th rnd: Working in back loops only, sl st in each st and ch around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Plush™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 146 yds/133 m)
Contrast A Mustard (68029) 2 balls or 212 yds/194 m
Contrast B Off White (68014) 1 ball or 128 yds/117 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] diameter x 10" [25.5 cm] high.
gauge: 9 hdc and 7 rnds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• When changing colors, work hdc to last 3 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 3 loops and proceed in new color, keeping color change to WS of work.
• Carry color not in use along top of last row and work new sts around carried color.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
• Join with sl st to first hdc at end of each rnd.
Base
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 10 hdc in ring. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Join. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 4 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 4 hdc. Join. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 5 hdc. Join. 70 hdc.
9th rnd: As 7th rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 6 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 6 hdc. Join. 80 hdc.
11th rnd: As 7th rnd. Join B with sl st to first hdc.
Sides
Proceed in Checker Pat as follows:
1st to 3rd rnds: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc. With A, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Join B with sl st to first hdc at end of 1st and 2nd rnds. Join A with sl st to first hdc at end of 3rd rnd.
4th to 6th rnds: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. *With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last 5 hdc. With B, 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Join A with sl st to first hdc at end of 4th and 5th rnds. Join B with sl st to first hdc at end of 6th rnd.
These 6 rnds form Checker Pat.
Rep 6 rnds of Checker Pat once more, then 1st to 3rd rnds once more.
Break B.
Top Edge
With A only, ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Misty Jungle Green (04801) 2 balls or 365 yds/335 m
Contrast B Vanilla (04008) 1 ball or 165 yds/150 m
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 6" [15 cm] high.
gauge: 7½ sc and 7 rows = 4" (10 cm) with 2 strands held together.
instructions:
Basket
With 2 strands of A held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.

9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 6" [15 cm]. Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join 2 strands of B with sl st to first sc. 66 sc. Break A.
Next rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.
