Next rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn.

First Petal: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 2 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 13 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. 11 sc. 5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. 9 sc. 6th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 5 sc. Fasten off.

Second through Sixth Petals: With RS facing, join 2 strands of B with sl st to first unworked st of last rnd of Basket. Work 1st to 6th rows as given for First Petal.

materials: Bernat® Blanket (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A Misty Green (10878) 3 Balls
Bernat® Blanket™ O’Go™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast B Scuba (42015) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] diameter x 9½" [24.5 cm] high.
gauge: 7 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Start crocheting!
With 1 strand each of A and B held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.
Cont in this manner, inc 8 sc evenly around next 5 rnds (as estab - lished). 104 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 9" [23 cm].
Next rnd (Handle openings):
Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 42 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch-1 sp around. Join.
Next rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
Handles: With 1 strand each of A and B held tog, ch 26. Thread chain through first ch-1 sp of Handle opening rnd and back out through second ch-1 sp of same rnd. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist.
Next rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around, rotating chain through Handle opening for ease of working. Join. Fasten off. 
Rep for second Handle.

materials: RED HEART® Collage™: 6 balls 9981 Dollhouse
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 9mm [US M-13]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Basket measures 13" (33 cm) in diameter and 10" (25.5 cm) tall.
gauge: 7 sts = 4" (10 cm); 6 rows = 4" (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
BASKET BASE
Note: The sts making up this base should be relatively tight and stiff. This allows the base of the basket to have structure and not bend too much when carrying yarn. If your sts are too loose, you can make the sts tighter by either using more tension or switching to a smaller hook.
Round 1: Ch 5 (does not count as a st here and throughout), slip st to first ch to form a ring; 8 sc in ring; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in each of the following sts; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 17 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 25 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 33 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first st, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 41 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each st; slip st to top of beginning ch to join.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first st, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 10 times; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 51 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first st, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 12 times, sc in next 2 sts; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 63 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in first st, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 15 times, sc in next 2 sts; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 78 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in first st, [sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in next st] 7 times, slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 85 sc.
Do not break yarn.
BASKET WALLS
Round 11: Ch 3, dc in the back loop of each st; slip st to top of beginning ch to join.
Round 12: Ch 3, *BS1, 2 dc in space between last st and next st, BS2, 4 dc, puff st, 4 dc; repeat from * around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 5 BS1, 5 BS2, 5 puff st, 50 dc.
Round 13: Ch 3, *[FPEdc] 4 times, skip 2 sts, [FPEdc] 4 times, 4 dc, dc in puff st, 4 dc; repeat from * around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 40 FPEdc, 45 dc.
Round 14: Ch 3, *BS1, 2 dc in space between last st and next st, BS2, 3 dc, puff st, dc, puff st, 3 dc; repeat from * around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 5 BS1, 5 BS2, 45 dc, 10 puff sts.
Round 15: Ch 3, *[FPEdc] 4 times, skip 2 sts, [FPEdc] 4 times, 3 dc, dc in puff st, dc, dc in puff st, 3 dc; repeat from * around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 40 FPEdc, 45 dc.
Rounds 16-19: Repeat Rounds 12-15.
Round 20: Ch 1, sc in each st; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 85 sc.
Round 21: Ch 1, 5 sc, ch 14, skip 10 sts, 31 sc, ch 14, skip 10 sts, sc in each remaining st around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 65 sc, 28 ch.
Round 22: Ch 1, 5 sc, sc in each ch, 31 sc, sc in each ch, sc in each remaining st around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join – 85 sc.
Round 23: Ch 1, sc in each st around; slip st to top of beginning ch to join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, weave in any loose ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Aran (0313) 4 balls
Contrast B Perfect Pink (0706) 1 ball
Contrast C Light Periwinkle (0347) 1 ball
Contrast D Aruba Sea (0505) 1 ball
Contrast E Hot Red (0390) 1 ball
Contrast F Hunter Green (0389) 1 ball
Contrast G Soft Navy (0387) 2 balls
Contrast H Spring Green (0672) 2 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 50” x 59” [127 x 150 cm]
gauge: 12 dc and 7.5 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Blanket is worked diagonally from corner to corner. 
• When working from Chart, wind small balls of the colors to be used, one for each separate area of color in the design. 
• Start new colors at appropriate points. To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook, yoh with new color, pull through 2 loops on hook to complete st and proceed in new color.
BLANKET
With A, ch 6. See crochet diagram on page 2 and Blanket Chart on page 3. Each square of chart represents 1 block. 
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of last 2 ch. Turn. 1 block made. 
2nd row: Ch 6. 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch – beg block made.  (Sl st. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp – block made. Turn. 2 blocks. 
3rd row: Beg block. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 3 blocks. 
Keeping cont of color changes in Chart on page 3 (each square on grid represents 1 block), rep last row until 60th row of chart is complete. 60 blocks. 
Keeping cont of Chart, proceed as follows to work sides even: 
61st row: Sl st in each of first 3 dc. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
62nd row:  Beg block. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. Sl st in last ch-3 sp. (Do not make a block.) Turn. 
63rd to 72nd rows:  Rep last 2 rows 5 times more.
Keeping cont of Chart, proceed as follows to dec corner: 
73rd row: (RS). Sl st in each of first 3 dc. *Block in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * to last ch-3 sp. Sl st in last ch-3 sp. (Do not make a block). Turn. 
Keeping cont of Chart, rep last row until 1 block rem. 
Fasten off.
Edging: 
1st rnd:  (RS). Join A with sl st to any corner. Ch 3 (counts as dc). 
Work dc evenly around, working 5 dc in each corner. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd:  Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc around, working 5 dc in each corner dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.

pattern_name: Stitch Club Pop! Bulky Crochet Basket
materials: Bernat® Pop! Bulky™ (9.8 oz/280 g; 147 yds/138 m) Shades of Gray (93002) 2 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] diameter x 9½" [24.5 cm] high.
gauge: 8 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 12 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 9 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 9 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 66 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 8½” [20.5 cm].
Make handles: Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 23 sc. Ch 10. Skip next 10 sc. Rep from * once more. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 23 sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. Rep from * once more. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball
Contrast A Hot Blue (01742) 1 ball
Contrast B Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball
Contrast C Hot Green (01712) 1 ball
Main Color (MC) Hot Blue (01742) 1 ball
Contrast A Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball
Contrast B Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball
Contrast C Hot Green (01712) 1 ball
Main Color (MC) Hot Pink (01740) 1 ball
Contrast A Hot Orange (01628) 1 ball
Contrast B Hot Blue (01742) 1 ball
Contrast C Hot Green (01712) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] diameter x 7" [18 cm] high.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook. 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
BASKET
With smaller hook and MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sc.
10th to 14th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. (1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 51 sc.
16th to 20th rnds: As 10th rnd.
21st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
22nd to 24th rnds: As 10th rnd.
25th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. (1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 45 sc.
26th to 28th rnds: As 10th rnd.
29th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sts.
30th to 32nd rnds: As 10th rnd.
33rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. (1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 39 sc. Ch 7 (for hanging loop). Join with sl st to first ch. Fasten off.

LARGE FLOWER (make 1)
With larger hook and A, ch 3. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 7 sc into ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 10. 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc in each of next 8 ch. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 10. 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc in each of next 8 ch. Rep from * 5 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 7 petals.

SMALL FLOWER (See Chart 2)
With larger hook and B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 7. 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc in each of next 5 ch. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 7. 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc in each of next 5 ch. Rep from * 3 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 5 petals.

LEAF (make 4)
With larger hook and C, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. (2 hdc. Ch 2. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 2 hdc) in last ch. Working into opposite side of ch, work 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off leaving a long tail for stitching.

FINISHING
Fold top edge approx 2½" [6 cm] to RS. Layer Small Flower on top of Large Flower and sew on button to center through all layers. Sew Flower to Basket front as shown in picture. Sew Leaves randomly around Flowers as shown in picture.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Oatmeal (0326) 1 ball
Contrast B Pretty‘n Pink (0722) 1 ball
Contrast C Minty (0520) 1 ball
Size U.S. 7 [4.5 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 5" x 5" x 5" [12.5 x 12.5 x 12.5 cm] cube.
gauge: 14 dc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = Approx 5" [12.5 cm] square.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc.
• Ch 6 at beg of rnd counts as dc and ch-3 sp.
• To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color, yoh with new color and proceed.
Plain Motif (make 3)
With B, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 6. (3 dc in ring. Ch 3) 3 times. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-6. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join C with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-6.
3rd rnd: Sl st into next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-6. Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join A with sl st in any ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 4 dc in same sp as sl st. *(1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc.** 5 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-3. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Heart Motif (make 2)
With B, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 6. (3 dc in ring. Ch 3) 3 times. 2 dc in ring. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-6.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. *(3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * twice more. 2 dc in next ch-3 sp. Join with sl st in 3rd ch of ch-6.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. (Ch 3. 2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp, changing to A in last dc. With A, ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. With B, ch 1 to change color. With B, 3 dc in next ch-1 sp, changing to A in last dc. With A, ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. With B, ch 1 to change color. With B, (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp, changing to A in last dc. With A, ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break B.
4th rnd: With A, ch 3. 1 dc in each of the next 2 dc. 5 dc in next ch-3 sp. *(1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice.** 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 5 dc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch-3. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Handles (make 2)
With A, ch 32, leaving a long end to attach to Basket.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 28 ch. 30 dc. Fasten off, leaving a long end to attach to Basket.
Assembly
Place 2 Plain Motifs WS tog. With A sl st across edge of both Motifs to join. Rep with 3rd Plain Motif to create a strip (see diagram). Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Place Heart Motif WS tog onto center Plain Motif. With A sl st across edge of both squares to join. Rep for 2nd Heart Motif on opposite side. (Note direction of Motifs on diagram). Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Fold up 4 outer Motifs tog and sl st along sides to form Basket. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Using long yarn ends on Handles, sl st to top edge of 2 Plain Motifs, beg at first dc after ch-3 sp. Fasten off and weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Maker Big™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 77 yds/70 m) Main Color (MC) Ivory (25002) 7 balls
Caron® x Pantone™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 127 yds /116 m) Ocean Surf (01008) 2 braids
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch markers.
measurements: Approx 16" [40.5 cm] wide x 18½" [47 cm] tall.
gauge: 7.5 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with Bernat® Maker Big™.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row counts as hdc.
With MC ch 3.
1st rnd: (RS). 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 70 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 6 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 80 hdc.
9th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 7 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 90 hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 8 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 100 hdc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep 12th rnd until work from 11th rnd measures 12" [30.5 cm].
Next 6 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Turn. Place marker at end of each rnd and turn work at end of each rnd.
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not turn.
Rep last rnd until work from 11th rnd measures 18" [45.5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fringe: Cut strands of A, B, C, D, and E 14" [35.5 cm] long. *Taking 2 strands of A, knot fringe into front bar of first 5 sts of 2nd marked rnd. Skip next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Trim Fringe as shown in picture.
*Taking 2 strands of E, knot fringe into front bar of first 5 sts of 4th marked rnd. Taking 2 strands of C, knot fringe into front bar of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Trim Fringe as shown in picture.
*Taking 2 strands of D, knot fringe in front bar of first 5 sts of 6th marked rnd. Taking 2 strands of B, knot fringe in front bar of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Trim Fringe as shown in picture.
Fringe: Cut yarn 10 to 14 ins [25.5 to 35.5 cm] long. Taking 2 or 3 strands together for each fringe knot into fringe across cast on and cast off edges. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Bernat® Pop! Bulky™ (9.8 oz/280 g; 147 yds/138 m) Omni-Pop (93012) 2 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] diameter x 9½" [24.5 cm] high.
gauge: 8 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 12 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 3 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 3 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 9 hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 9 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 66 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 8½" [20.5 cm].
Make handles: Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 23 sc. Ch 10. Skip next 10 sc. Rep from * once more. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 23 sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. Rep from * once more. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Plush™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 146 yds/133 m)
Contrast A Deep Woods (68025) 3 balls or 405 yds/370 m
Contrast B Spruce (68027) 1 ball or 82 yds/75.5 m
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® stitch marker
Susan Bates® yarn needle
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] diameter x 9½" [24.5 cm] high.
gauge: 7 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.
Cont in this manner, inc 8 sc evenly around next 5 rnds (as established). 104 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.

Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 8" [20.5 cm]. Join B at end of last rnd.
With B, rep last rnd twice more. Do not fasten off.
Next rnd (Handle openings):
Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 42 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch-1 sp around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
Handles: With B, ch 26. Thread chain through first ch-1 sp of Handle opening rnd and back out through second ch-1 sp of same rnd. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around, rotating chain through Handle opening for ease of working. Join. Fasten off.
Rep for second Handle.

materials: Bernat® Suede-ish™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 179 yds/164 m)
Contrast A Tusk (91006) 1 ball
Contrast B Gems (91018) 1 ball
Contrast C Turquoise (91009) 1 ball
Contrast D Cedarwood (91002) 1 ball
Contrast E Garnet (91007) 1 ball
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Popcorn = Work 3 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 3-dc group. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] in diameter x 7½" [19 cm] tall.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Base: With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.
9th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
10th rnd: 1 hdcbp around each sc around. Fasten off.
Shape Sides: Join A with sl st to horizontal bar below loops normally worked on WS of work.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
**2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Do not join. From this point on, work in continuous spiral moving marker on first st up each rnd.
3rd to 6th rnd: 1 hdc in each st around.
Join B at end of 6th rnd.
Next rnd: With B and working in back loops only, ch 1. *1 sc in next st. Popcorn in next st. Rep from * around, joining A to last st. Break B.
Next rnd: With A and working in both loops, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around.**
Rep from ** to ** twice more.
Next rnd: 1 hdc in each st around.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Working from right to left instead of left to right as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
Fringe: Cut lengths of C, D and E 5" [12.5 cm] long. Knot into 3 rnds of fringe in rem front loops of rnds below bobbles as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins each 319 Cherry Red A and 312 Black C; 1 skein each of 316 Soft White B and 321 Gold D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.5mm [US I-9]
Plastic 1-bushel basket, 16¾” (42 cm) in diameter, 12¾” (32 cm) tall
stitch marker
yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = Color A, B, C, D
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Basket Measurements: 16¾” (42 cm) in diameter; 12¾” (32 cm) tall.
gauge: 14 sc = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTES
1. Basket cover and liner are worked from bottom to top.  Popcorn trim is worked up from upper edge of basket cover and then sewn to top of basket liner after basket is inserted.
2. Basket cover and liner are worked in continuous rounds.  Place a detachable marker at beginning of rounds to mark beginning and end of rounds and move up as work progresses.
3. Basket is for decoration only. If photographing a baby, never leave unattended.
SPECIAL STITCHES: 
popcorn = 3 dc in same st, drop loop from hook, insert hook from front to back in first dc, draw dropped loop through st on hook.
BASKET COVER
Beginning at bottom, with A, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral). Pull gently on tail to tighten ring. Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc. 
Round 3: *2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sc. 
Round 4: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around—24 sc. 
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * around—36 sc. 
Round 7: *Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—42 sc. 
Round 8: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc; repeat from * around—48 sc. 
Round 9: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc; repeat from * around—54 sc. 
Round 10: *Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * around—60 sc.
Round 11: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc; repeat from * around—66 sc. 
Round 12: *Sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—72 sc. 
Round 13: *Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc; repeat from * around—78 sc. 
Round 14: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc; repeat from * around—84 sc. 
Round 15: *Sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * around—90 sc. 
Round 16: *Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc; repeat from * around—96 sc. 
Round 17: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 14 sc; repeat from * around—102 sc.
Round 18: *Sc in next 16 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—108 sc.
At this point the circle should be close to the diameter of the base of basket – if not then work one or two more rounds in sc.
Round 19: Working in the back loops only, sc in each sc around.
Work even in rounds of sc for 1” (2.5 cm) from base of Round 19.
Next round (increase): *2 sc in next st, sc in each of next 17 sts; repeat from * around—114 sc.
**Work even in rounds of sc for 1” (2.5 cm) from base of last round.
Next round (increase): Work in sc, increasing 6 evenly around—120 sts.**
Repeat from ** to ** 7 times—162 sc at end of last round. Work even in rounds of sc until piece measures about 2” (5 cm) less than height of basket, complete last st with B. Fasten off A.
Popcorn Trim
Round 1 With B, sc in each st around—162 sc.
Round 2:  *Popcorn in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around—81 popcorns.
Round 3: Sc in each of next 161 sts, ending in the popcorn of previous round.
Rounds 4–13: Repeat last 2 rounds 6 times. 
Round 14: Sc in each st around, join with a slip st in next st. Fasten off B.
Liner
With C, work same as Basket Cover through Round 18.  
Round 19: Working in the front loops only, sc in each sc around. 
Work the same as Basket Cover, excluding Popcorn Trim, do not change to B. Fasten off C.
Buckle
Starting at side, with D, ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—12 sc.
Rows 2–3: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each of first 3 sc, ch 6, skip next 6 sts, sc in each of last 3 sc, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each of first 3 sc, 6 sc in next ch-6 sp, sc in each of last 3 sc, turn—12 sc.
Rows 6–9:  Repeat Rows 2-5.
Rows 10–11:  Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. 
Edging: With Right Side facing, slip st evenly around outer edge of Buckle. 
Fasten off.
Belt
With C, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Repeat Row 2 until Belt measures all the way around center of basket, slightly stretched. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Slip basket into basket cover with popcorn trim coming over top of rim of basket. Slip liner into basket and neatly sew top edge of liner to last round of popcorn trim. 
Insert one end of belt through belt buckle and sew to other end of belt. 
Tack join behind the belt buckle. Belt can be tacked to basket if necessary.

materials: Bernat® Maker Home Dec™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Colors: Cream (11009) 1 ball or 310 yds/284 m to make 2 Baskets (Small and Large) or Aqua (11005) 1 ball or 310 yds/284 m to make 2 Baskets (Small and Large)
• Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
• Susan Bates® split-lock stitch count marker.
• Susan Bates® steel yarn needle.
• Tape measure.
measurements: Large Basket Approx 6¾" [17 cm] diameter x 9" [23 cm] unfolded. Small Basket Approx 4½" [11.5 cm] diameter x 7" [18 cm] unfolded.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
USING THIS GUIDE
Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools.
INSTRUCTIONS
MAKE THIS
Slip Knot : Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then pull through to make slip knot.
Chain : Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw up a loop - 1 chain made.
Single Crochet : Insert hook in indicated stitch. Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw through loop – 2 loops on hook. Yarn over hook (Yoh) and draw through both loops on hook – 1 single crochet made.

Small Basket
(See Diagram on page 7).
Base: Chain (ch) 2.
1st rnd: 8 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Join with Slip Stitch to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next sc - Corner made. 1 sc in next sc. Repeat (rep) from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next sc for corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-1 space (sp). 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Place Marker (PM) at end of rnd. 44 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.

Large Basket
(See Diagram on page 9).
Base: Rep 1st to 6th rnds as for Small Basket. Do not place marker at end of 6th rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 52 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sc and and 4 ch-1 sps.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next corner ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Place Marker (PM) at end of rnd. 68 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.
Sides: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sc. *Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. Rep from * twice more. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 68 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 9" [23 cm]. Fasten off. Fold top 3" [7.5 cm] to RS as seen in picture.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Twists (2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Green Twists (20244) 4 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 5 x 10 x 6" [12.5 x 25.5 x 15 cm], with top unfolded.
gauge: 13 1⁄2 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn tog.
instructions:
SIDES (make in one piece).
With 2 strands of yarn, ch 21.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 20 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending with a WS row.
**Next row: (RS). (Fold line). Ch 1. Working through back loops only, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Working through both loops, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until work from last fold line measures 10" [25.5 cm], ending with a WS row.**
Next row: (RS). (Fold line). Ch 1. Working through back loops only, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Working through both loops, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until work from last fold line measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending with a WS row.
Rep from ** to ** once more.
Next row: (RS). (Joining row). Place foundation ch behind last row with WS of work tog. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
BASE
With 2 strands of yarn, ch 35. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 34 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row until work from beg measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending with a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Join Base to Sides: Place lower edge of Sides behind Base with WS of work tog, aligning corners of Base with fold lines and joining row of Sides.
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc around all 4 sides of Base. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fold top edge of Basket to RS as shown in picture.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Big™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 32 yds/29 m) Glacier Blue (51104) 3 balls or 94 yds/86 m
Size U.S. U/50 (25 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
abbreviations: Scyuh (single crochet with yarn under hook) = Insert hook into next stitch. Bring yarn under hook instead of yarn over hook and pull up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 13½" [34.5 cm] diameter x 10" [25.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 2 sc and 2 rows = 4" [10 cm]. 3 scyuh and 2.5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
BASE
Note: For base: join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 14 sc.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 21 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.

SIDE
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 scyuh in each sc around. Do not join. 
Proceed as follows, working in spiral, PM on first st and move up each rnd for easier counting:
2nd rnd: 1 scyuh in each st around.
Rep last rnd until Side measures approx 6½" [16.5 cm] tall.

HANDLES
Next rnd: 1 scyuh in each of next 6 sts. Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts. 1 scyuh in each of next 13 sts. Ch 3. Skip next 3 sts. 1 scyuh in each of last 7 sts. Do not join. 
Cont working in spiral as follows:
Next rnd: 1 scyuh in each scyuh and ch around. 32 scyuh. Join with sl st in first st.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Note: Scyuh will lean in one direction – to emphasize ‘crossed stitch’ look, realign stitches to stack on top of each other by pulling fabric in opposite direction of lean.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ O’Go™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Toasted Almond (42004) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
3" [7.5 cm] piece of cardboard for Tassels.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Splsc = Split Single Crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
measurements: Approx 11" [28 cm] diameter x 7½"[19 cm] tall, excluding handles.
gauge: 7 splsc and 8.5 rounds= 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
BASKET
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.

CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: EASY

BASKET
Wth A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.

Cont working in spiral as follows:
2nd rnd: 2 splsc in each sc around. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in next st. Rep from * around. 18sts.
4th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
5th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
6th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
7th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. 42 sts.
8th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
9th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. 54 sts.
10th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 60 sts.

Do not fasten off.

Cont with Side as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st around. 60 sts.

Cont working in spiral as follows:
2nd rnd: Skip ch-1. 1 splsc in each st around. 60 sts.
3rd rnd: 1 splsc in each st around. Join B. Break A
4th to 12th rnds: With B, 1 splsc in each st around. Join C. Break B.
13th rnd: With C, 1 splsc in each of first 11 sts. Ch 10. Skip next 8 sts – Handle made. Being careful not to twist chain, 1 splsc in each of next 22 sts. Ch 10. Skip next 8 sts – Handle made. Being careful not to twist chain, 1 splsc in each of last 11 sts.
14th rnd:  1 splsc in each of first 11 sts. 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. 1 splsc in each of next 22 sts. 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. 1 splsc in each of last 11 sts.
15th and 16th rnds:  1 splsc in each st around. Join with sl st in first st.

Fasten off.

FINISHING
Tassel Garland
Note: Tassel Garland worked over multiple of 4 ch + 2.
With C, ch 26.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 25 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 5. Skip each of first 4 sc. Sl st in next sc *Ch 5. Skip next 3 sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Top Edging and Ties: (RS). With C, ch 14 – Tie made. Sl st in each rem loop from foundation ch of Garland. Ch 14 – Tie made. Fasten off.
Tassels (make 6): Wrap C around 3" [7.5 cm] piece of cardboard 15 times. With C, tie securely at one end leaving Long Tails. Cut across other end. Wrap A 3 times around tassel 1" [2.5 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. Secure 1 Tassel to each ch-5 sp along Garland using Long Tails.
Tie Tassel Garland to Basket handles (as shown in photo).

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Chunky™: 3 skeins 0334 Buff A; 1 skein each 0400 Grey Heather B and 0776 Dark Orchid C.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10½]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Basket measures 36" (91.4 cm) in circumference at widest point.
gauge: 10 sc = 4" (10 cm); 10 sc rows = 4" (10 cm) with two strands held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With two strands of A held together, make an adjustable ring as follows: Wrap yarn around your finger with the yarn tail to the left and under the working yarn. Insert hook through the circle from front to back. Using the working yarn, yarn over and pull up a loop.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc 6 in ring. Join with a slip stitch to first sc; tighten beginning yarn tail to close ring – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st to first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, *sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, *sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 42 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, *sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 48 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, *sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 54 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, *sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 60 sc.
Round 11: Ch 1, *sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 66 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, *sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 72 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around; join with slip st to first sc.
Rounds 14-16: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st to first sc.
Round 17: Ch 1, *sc in next 11 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 78 sc.
Rounds 18–20: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st to first sc.
Round 21: Ch 1, *sc in next 12 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 84 sc.
Rounds 22–24: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st to first sc.
Round 25: Ch 1, *sc in next 13 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 90 sc.
Round 26: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st to first sc.
Cut A.
With two strands of B held together:
Round 27: Ch 1, hdc in each st around; join with a slip st to first hdc.
With two strands of C held together:
Round 28: Ch 1, *sc in next 13 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 84 sc.
Round 29: Ch 3, cluster st in first st, ch 1, *skip 1 st, cluster st in next st; repeat from * to last st, skip last st, join with slip st to first cluster.
Round 30: Ch 1, *[2 sc in next cluster st] six times, sc in top of next cluster st; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 78 sc.
Cut C.
With two strands of B held together:
Round 31: Ch 1, hdc in each st around; join with a slip st to first hdc.
Cut B.
With two strands of A held together:
Round 32: Ch 1, *sc in next 11 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 72 sc.
Round 33: Ch 1, *sc in next 10 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * to end of round, join with slip st to first sc – 66 sc.
Fasten off.
Handles (Make 2)
With two strands of A held together and leaving an 8" (20.3 cm) tail for seaming, ch 20.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 19 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 1, hdc in each st across.
Fasten off, leaving an 8" (20.3 cm) tail for seaming.
FINISHING
With yarn needle, seam each Handle end to the inside of the basket along Round 32, leaving 5 sc between each Handle's edge.
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 492 yds/450 m)
Version 1
Contrast A Cuddly Cloud (86018) 1 ball or 320 yds/ 293 m
Contrast B Sky Blue (86011) 1 ball or 16 yds/ 15 m
Contrast C Indigo Velvet (86035) 1 ball or 62 yds/ 57 m
Version 2
Contrast A Cuddly Cloud (86018) 1 ball or 320 yds/ 293 m
Contrast B Orchid Hush (86005) 1 ball or 16 yds/ 15 m
Contrast C Ever After Pink (86020) 1 ball or 62 yds/ 57 m
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Purchased bushel basket 11¾" [30 cm] in diameter x 9" [23 cm] tall.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 11¾" [30 cm] diameter x 9" [23 cm] tall (with edge folded).
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
• Carry color when not in use loosely across top of previous rnd and work sts around it to avoid stranding.
• When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
Basket Base: With A, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc. 
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 sc. 
11th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 88 sc. 
12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 96 sc. 
13th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 104 sc. 
14th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 112 sc. 
15th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 120 sc. 
Basket Upper: 16th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, *With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
From this point on, turn at end of each rnd. 
17th rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Working in both loops, *With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
18th rnd: (RS). Ch 1. *With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
19th rnd: (WS). Ch 1. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Break A. Turn. 
20th rnd: (RS). Ch 1. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With C, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
21st rnd: (WS). Ch 1. *With C, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
22nd and 23rd rnds: As 20th and 21st rnds once more. Break C.
24th rnd: (RS). Ch 1. *With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
25th rnd: (WS). Ch 1. *With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
26th and 27th rnd: As 24th and 25th rnds once more. Break A. 
Rep 20th through 27th rnds for Gingham Pat until Basket Upper measures approx 9" [23 cm], ending with a 23rd or 27th rnd.
Handle Openings: Cont in Gingham Pat as established, proceed as follows;
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Pat across next 22 sc. Cont with color of last st, ch 16. Skip next 16 sc (break colors not in use to avoid stranding over handle opening). Pat across next 44 sc. Ch 16. Skip next 16 sc. Pat to end of rnd. Join. Turn.
Next rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Pat across each sc and ch around. Join. Turn.
Cont in Gingham Pat until work from Handle Openings measures approx 4" [10 cm] ending on a 23rd or 27th rnd. 
Next rnd: (RS). With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast A Warm Brown (01130)  3 balls or 337 yds/308 m
Contrast B Soft Ecru (01004)  2 balls or 148 yds/136 m
Contrast C Red (00095)  2 balls or 148 yds/136 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Approx 9” [23 cm] square x 51/2" [14 cm] high.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• When joining new color while working lining, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry color not in use loosely across top of previous row and work sts around it to prevent stranding.
BASKET SIDES (make 4)
With A, ch 37.
1st row:(RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 35 dc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around each of next 3 dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. Dcfp around each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 4 sts. Dcbp around each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
4th row: As 3rd row.
5th row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Dcbp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 4 sts. Dcfp around each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 5th rows for pat twice more. Fasten off.
BASKET BASE
With A, ch 37.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 36 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece measures approx 9” [23 cm]. Fasten off.
LINING SIDES (make 4)
With B, ch 37.
1st row: (RS). With B, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. *With A, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. With B, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Turn. 36 sc.
First row of Chart is now complete.
Cont in Chart, working 1st to 8th rows twice, then 1st to 4th rows once (20 rows total). Fasten off.
LINING BASE
Work from ** to ** as given for Lining Sides.
Cont in Chart, working 1st to 8th rows 4 times, then 1st to 4th rows once (36 rows total). Fasten off.
FINISHING
Join Basket Sides: With WS tog, join A with sl st to bottom right corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc evenly to top edge to join sides. Fasten off.
Rep for rem 3 sides.
Join Basket Base to Sides: Place lower edge of Sides behind Base with WS of work tog, aligning corners of Base with side seams. Join A with sl st to any corner.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around all 4 sides of Base, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Join Lining Sides: With RS tog, join B with sl st to bottom right corner. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc evenly to top edge to join sides. Fasten off. Rep for rem 3 sides.
Join Lining Base to Lining Sides: Place lower edge of Lining Sides behind Lining Base with RS of work tog, aligning corner of Base with side seams. Join B with sl st to any corner.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around all 4 sides of Lining Base, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Join Basket to Lining: Place Lining inside Basket, making sure all corners are aligned properly and top edges are even.
1st rnd: With RS of Lining facing you, join A with sl st to any sc. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc evenly around top edge to join Basket and Lining. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Turn work so RS of Basket is facing you. Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 rnd of reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Tea Cakes™ (8.5 oz/240 g; 204 yds/186 m)
Contrast A Warm Night (20047) 2 cakes
Contrast B Wild Cherry (20053) 1 cake
Size U.S. L/11 [8 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
Locking stitch marker.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet back loop only
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] high and 8" [20.5 cm] in diameter.
gauge: 9.5 hdc and 6 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands held tog.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
• Rnds are joined with sl st to first hdc unless otherwise noted.
BASKET
With 2 strands of A held tog, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 10 hdc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each st around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next st. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. PM on last st. 1 hdc in each st around to marked st. Do not join. Beg working in spiral, PM on 1st st of rnd for easier counting.
8th rnd: *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous rnd (bar is below loops normally worked on WS. See diagram). Rep from * around. 
Rep 8th rnd until work from 7th rnd measures 5½" [14 cm]. 
Work contrast edge of Basket as follows:
1st rnd: *Work 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous rnd. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Break A. Join B held double.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 14 sts. 1 scbl in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Fringed Trim
Holding Basket upside down, with base facing up, join 1 strand of B with sl st in first unworked front loop of 2nd rnd of contrast edge. 
Next rnd: (Ch 20. Sl st into next unworked front loop.) 3 times. Ch 20. Join with sl st in first st.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Cut strands of A 8" [20.5 cm] long. Taking 4 strands tog fold in half and knot into fringe in every other st around. Trim evenly.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Confetti ™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Beige Confetti (62019) 2 balls
Contrast B Vapor Confetti (62005) 2 balls
Contrast C Terra Cotta Confetti (62012) 2 balls
Sizes U.S. L/11 (8 mm) and U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Yarn needle
Locking stitch marker
measurements: Approx 19" [48.5 cm] diameter x 13" [33 cm] high.
gauge: 7 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook and 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions:
BASKET
Notes:
• To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook of previous colors. Yoh with new colors, draw through rem loops and proceed with new color.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
With larger hook and 1 strand each of B and C held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.
Cont in this manner, inc 8 sc evenly around each of next 5 rnds (as established). 104 sc. On last rnd, break C. Join A.
With 1 strand each of A and B held tog, proceed as follows:
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 11" [28 cm]. On last rnd, break B. Join 1 strand of C.
Next rnd: With 1 strand of each of A and C held tog, ch 1. Working into both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Make handles: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. Ch 6. Skip next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 46 sc. Ch 6. Skip next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 1 sc in each of next 46 ch. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc. Join.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.
PATCH
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc.
With smaller hook and 1 strand of C, ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 6 dc in 4th ch from hook. (Skipped ch-3 counts as dc.) Turn. 7 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. Working in front loops only, 1 dc in first dc. 2 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 14 dc.
3rd row: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 21 dc.
4th row: Ch 3. Working in front loops only, 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 28 dc.
5th row: Ch 3. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to end of row. Do not turn. 35 dc.
Ch 1. Sl st evenly across straight edge of Patch.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Center Patch between 2 handles opposite beg of rnd join. With RS facing, sew Patch onto Basket, with long edge 5 rnds down from top of Basket.
Fringe: Cut strands of A 10" [25.5 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe in back loops only along curved edge of Patch. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Dark Teal 1 ball or 100 yds/91.5 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] tall, unfolded and excluding handle.
gauge: 8 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
6 sc.
Cont working in spiral as follows moving st marker onto first st of each rnd as you go:
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around.
12 sts.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around.
18 sc.
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around.
24 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around.
30 sc.
6th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around.
36 sc.
7th to 26th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Next rnd: Ch 8. Skip each of first 6 sc – Handle made. Being careful not to twist chain, 1 sc in each of last 30 sc.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each of first 8 ch. 1 sc in each of last 30 sc.
38 sc.
Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g;120 yds/109 m)
Sizes Small      Medium
2 balls or 140 yds/128 m
3 balls or 260 yds/240 m
Yellow (00010), Tangerine (01699) or Hot Green (01712)
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch from front to back to front. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Small: Approx 6" [15 cm] diameter x 5½" [14 cm] high. Medium: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] diameter x 7" [18 cm] high.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
The instructions are written for smaller size. If changes are necessary for larger size the instructions will be written thus ( ). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes.
Base: Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
Cont in this manner, inc 6 sc evenly around each rnd, for 4 (8) more rnds. 60 (84) sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 9 (13) sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 66 (90) sc.
Place marker at end of last rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
Main Section: Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dcfp around post of next st. 1 hdc in next st. Rep from * around to last st. 1 dcfp around post of last st. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 dcfp around post of same st as last sl st. *1 hdc in next st. 1 dcfp around post of next st. Rep from * around to last st. 1 hdc in last st. Join with sl st to first st.
Rep last 2 rnds for pat until work from marked rnd measures 5 (6½)" [12.5 (16.5) cm].
Scallop Edging rnd: Ch 1. Sl st in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 2 sts. 5 dc in next st. Skip next 2 sts. Sl st in next st. Rep from * around, omitting sl st at end of last rep. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Big™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 32 yds/29 m) Vapor Gray (26039) 4 balls
Size U.S. Q (16 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] wide x 10" [25.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 4 sc and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 11
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 
10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg 
measures 10" [25.5 cm].
Beg working in rnds as follows:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first 
sc.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 
10 sc. Work 3 sc in corner. Work 
10 sc evenly along side edge of 
bottom. Work 3 sc in corner.
Rep from * around. Join. 52 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from first 
rnd measures 10" [25.5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left  
to right  instead of right  to left  as 
usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc 
around. Join.
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Maker Big™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 77 yds/70 m)
Shale (25004) 4 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 9½" [24 cm] high x 12" [30.5 cm] in diameter.
gauge: 7 hdc and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note:  Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 10 hdc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc.
6th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 hdc.
8th rnd:  Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 hdc.
9th rnd:  Ch 2. *Work 1 hdc into horizontal bar created below st in previous row on WS of work (bar is below loops normally worked on WS – see diagram). Rep from * around. Join.
10th to 13th rnds:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
14th rnd: As 9th rnd.
15th to 18th rnds: As 10th to 13th rnds.
19th rnd: As 9th rnd.
20th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 15 sts. Ch 12 for handle. Skip next 10 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 30 hdc. Ch 12 for handle. Skip next 10 hdc. 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 15 sts. 14 sc in next ch-12 sp. 1 sc in each of next 30 sts. 14 sc in next ch-12 sp. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Working in back loops only, sl st in each st around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: 1 (2, 2) skeins 312 Black A
1 skein each of 3950 Charcoal B
400 Grey Heather C
341 Light Grey D
Small: 530 Orchid E
528 Medium Purple F
776 Dark Orchid G
Medium: 390 Hot Red E
319 Cherry Red F
376 Burgundy G
Large: 505 Aruba Sea E
3862 Jade F
656 Real Teal G
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 10mm [US N-15]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Small basket measures about 8” [20.5 cm] tall and 30” [76 cm] circumference. Medium basket measures about 10” [25.5 cm] and 36” [91.5 cm] circumference. Large basket measures about 12” [30.5 cm] and 42” [106.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: 8 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 9½ rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet with 3 strands of yarn held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Base
With 3 strands of A held together, ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—54 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc.
Medium Basket Only:
Round 11: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—66 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc.
Large Basket Only:
Round 11: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—66 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 11 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—78 sc.
Round 14: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 12 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—84 sc.

Sides
All Baskets:
Next Round (right side): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—60 (72, 84) sc. 
Next 3 Rounds: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off A.
Next Round (right side): With right side facing and 3 strands of B held together, join yarn with sc in same st as joining, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Next 1 (2, 3) Rounds: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off B.
With 3 strands of C held together, repeat last 2 (3, 4) rounds. Fasten off C.
With 3 strands of D held together, repeat last 2 (3, 4) rounds. Fasten off D.
With 3 strands of E held together, repeat last 2 (3, 4) rounds. Fasten off E.
With 3 strands of F held together, repeat last 2 (3, 4) rounds. Fasten off F.
Next Round: With right side facing and 3 strands of G held together, join yarn with sc in same st as joining, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Next Round: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.

Handles
Next Round: Continue with G, ch 1, sc in first 10 (12, 14) sts, ch 10 (12, 14), skip next 10 (12, 14) sts, sc in next 20 (24, 28) sts, ch 10 (12, 14) sts, skip next 10 (12, 14) sts, sc in last 10 (12, 14) sts; join with slip st in first sc—40 (48, 56) sc and 2 ch-10 (12, 14) spaces.
Next Round: Ch 1, [sc in each st to next ch-space, 10 (12, 14) sc in ch-space] twice, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Last Round: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.

FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Caron® Spice Cakes™ (8 oz/227 g; 239 yds/218 m)
Main Color (MC) Silver Steel (27015) 3 balls
Contrast A Dark Spark (27018) 1 ball
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
Stitch marker.
measurements: Approx 11½" [29 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] high.
gauge: 7 sc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands held tog.
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch-1 sp counts as st. Work into sp not st.
• Join each rnd with sl st to first st.
BASKET  
Base: With 2 strands of MC held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5ht rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
Cont in this manner, inc 8 sc evenly around next 4 rnds (as established). 80 sc.
Side: Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd.
Proceed as follows:
1st rnd:  Ch 1. Working into both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
4th to 7th rnds:  As 2nd and 3rd rnds.
8th and 9th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 2nd to 9th rnds once more.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Fringe: Cut 240 lengths of MC 6" [15 cm] long. *Taking 3 strands tog, knot fringe into front loop only of first st of last rnd (top edge of Basket). Rep from * around. Trim fringe evenly.
Woven Bands:  Cut lengths of A 60" [152 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, thread onto yarn needle and beg at first rnd with ch-1 sps (2nd rnd), weave horizontally under and over ch-1 sps to create woven appearance. Rep for each rnd of ch-1 sps.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 4 skeins 1970 Taupe A
RED HEART® Hygge™: 2 balls 8319 Rust B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6.5mm [US K-10½] and 8mm [US L-11]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Basket measures 12" in diameter x 14" tall (30.5 cm x 35.5 cm) with open top.
gauge: 9 hdc = 4" (10cm); 6 rounds = 4" (10cm) with 4 strands of A and larger hook; 10 dc = 4" (10cm); 7 rounds = 4" (10cm) with 2 strands of B and smaller hook.
instructions:
Bottom 
With larger hook and 4 strands of A held together, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 10 hdc in ring; join with slip st in first hdc—10 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—20 hdc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next st, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—30 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 1, hdc in first 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, *hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—40 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 3 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—50 hdc.
Round 6: Ch 1, hdc in first 2 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around to last 2 sts, hdc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in first hdc—60 hdc.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 5 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—70 hdc.
Round 8: Ch 1, hdc in first 3 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 6 sts; repeat from * around to last 3 sts, hdc in last 3 sts; join with slip st in first hdc—80 hdc.
Round 9: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first st, hdc in next 7 sts, *2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 7 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first hdc—90 hdc.
Round 10: Ch 1, working back loops only, dc in each st around; join with slip st in first dc—90 dc.
Side
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each dc around; join with slip st in first sc—90 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, dc in first st, Fptr around next dc 2 rounds below, *dc in next st, Fptr around next dc 2 rounds below; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—45 dc and 45 tr.
Round 3: Repeat Round 1.
Round 4: Ch 1, Fptr around first dc 2 rounds below, dc in next st, *Fptr around next dc 2 rounds below, dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc.
Rounds 5–12: Repeat Rounds 1–4 twice or until Side measures 7" (18 cm); change color to 2 strands of B. Cut all strands of A.
Top
Round 1: With smaller hook, ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—90 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, dc in first 8 sts, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next 8 sts, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first dc—100 dc.
Round 3: Ch 1, dc in each st around; join with slip st in first dc
Repeat Round 3 until Top measures 6" (15 cm)
Eyelet Round: Ch 1, dc in first dc, *ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * around to last dc, ch 1 skip last dc; join with slip st in first dc—50 dc and 50 ch-1 spaces.
Last round: Ch 1, sc in each dc and ch-1 space around, join with slip st in first dc.
Fasten off.
Drawstring
With smaller hook and 2 strands of B held together, work as many ch as necessary for a 44-inch drawstring. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave drawstring through ch-1 spaces of Eyelet Round. Knot ends together to secure. Weave in ends.
