materials: 4 skeins 1101 Eggshell A
3 skeins 1401 Pewter B
2 skeins 1909 Holly Berry C
1 skein 1012 Black D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 11.5 mm [US P-16] (for basket) and 6 mm [US J-10] (for scarf and facial features)
Stitch marker
yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, B, C, and D
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Basket measures about 16" [40.5 cm] tall and 42" [106.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: 5 sts = about 3" [7.5 cm]; 5 rounds = about 3" [7.5 cm] in single crochet (sc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needle to obtain the gauge.
instructions: With smaller hook and 2 strands of C held together, ch 11. Row 1: Dc in 3rd ch from hook (2 skipped ch do not count as a st) and in each remaining ch across—9 dc. Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each dc across. Row 3: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), turn, dc in each st across. Rows 4–85: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 for 41 times. Row 86: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off. Before beginning basket, wind B and C into 4 separate, equal sized balls of yarn. With larger hook and 4 strands of A held together, ch 2. Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral). Place a marker in last stitch made. Move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc. Round 3: Repeat Round 2—24 sc. Round 4: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—30 sc. Round 5: [Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—36 sc. Round 6: [Sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—42 sc. Round 7: [Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—48 sc. Round 8: [Sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—54 sc. Round 9: [Sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—60 sc. Round 10: [Sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—66 sc. Round 11: [Sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—72 sc. Scalloped Lower Edge: Working in front loops only of Round 11 sts, slip st in first st, *2 hdc in next st, skip next st **, slip st in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **. Round 12: Working in back loops only of Round 11 sts, sc in each st around. Rounds 13–28: Sc in each st around; change to 4 strands of C held together in last st of Round 28. Rounds 29–32: With C, sc in each st around; change to 4 strands of B held together in last st of Round 32. Rounds 33–38: With B, sc in each st around. Round 39 (form handles): Sc in next 12 sts, ch 12, skip next 12 sts, sc in next 24 sts, ch 12, skip next 12 sts, sc in next 12 sts—48 sc and 2 ch-12 spaces. Round 40: Sc in next 12 sts, sc in next 12 ch, sc in next 24 sts, sc in next 12 ch, sc in next 12 sts; slip st in first sc of this round. Fasten off. With smaller hook and a single strand of C, ch 4. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—3 sc. Rows 2–6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, sc2tog—2 sc. Rows 8–12: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Row 13: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog—1 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing carrot nose to basket. With smaller hook and a single strand of D, ch 2. Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral). Place a marker in last stitch made. Move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] twice, slip st in next st; leave last st unworked. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing eye to basket. Use photograph as a guide to feature placement. Nose: Sew carrot nose at an angle between Rounds 22 and 26. Eyes: Sew an eye on each side of top of carrot nose, about 2 stitches away from nose. Mouth: With yarn needle and 2 strands of D held together, embroider a chain stitch smile beneath the carrot nose. Scarf: The scarf is longer than needed to reach around the basket, the ends are supposed to overlap. Before beginning, decide where you want the overlapping ends of the scarf to be. Carefully pin scarf in place around basket just above scalloped lower edge. When happy with the scarf placement, sew the top and lower edges to the basket leaving the overlapping ends loose. After edges of scarf are sewn to basket, gather the 9 sts of the first overlapping row on each overlapped end to make it look like the scarf ends have been tied together. Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra Thick™ (21.2 oz/600 g; 72 yds/66 m) Rose (62023) 3 balls or 216 yds/238 m
Size U.S. 50 (25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Twisted sc = Insert hook in next stitch. Bring hook over yarn instead of yarn over hook and pull up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. For Twisted sc watch video here.
measurements: Approx 22" [38 cm] diameter x 16" [40.5 cm] high.
gauge: 3.5 sc and 3 rows = 4" [10 cm] in twisted sc pat.
instructions:
Note: For bottom: join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 21 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 28 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 35 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 42 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 49 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Sides
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 twisted sc in each sc around. Join. 
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures approx 16" [40.5 cm]. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in next st. Rotate hook 360 degrees to twist 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Seafoam (04736) 2 balls or 230 yds/210 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® split-lock stitch count markers.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
Pair of safety eyes 14 mm diameter.
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn for embroidery.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 6½" [16.5 cm] tall x 10" [25.5 cm] diameter (excluding tail).
gauge: 9 sc and 7 rows = 4" (10 cm) with 2 strands of yarn held together.
instructions:
Note: Basket is worked with 2 strands of yarn held together throughout.
With 2 strands held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 50 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Do not join.
From this point on, Basket is worked in a spiral. Do not join at end of rnds. Place marker on first st of rnd and move marker up each subsequent rnd.
7th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 60 sc.
9th rnd: As 7th rnd.
10th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 70 sc.
11th to 14th rnds: As 7th rnd.
15th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 60 sts.
16th rnd: As 7th rnd.
17th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 50 sts.
18th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Sl st in first sc.
Fasten off.

Tail
With 2 strands of yarn held tog, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in last sc. 9 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in last sc. 11 sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). 1 tr in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 tr in each of last 2 sc.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Tail to Basket as seen in picture. Insert safety eyes. With 2 strands of black worsted weight yarn, embroider mouth with Back stitch as seen in picture.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 72 yds/65 m) Baby Pink (03200) 3 balls or 184 yds/168 m
Size U.S. J /10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Stuffing.
Small amount of smooth, black yarn for embroidery.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] diameter x 7" [18 cm] tall, excluding trunk.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
BASKET
Note: Join each rnd with sl st to first sc.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join. 32 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join. 40 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join. 48 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join. 56 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join. 64 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from marked row measures 7" [18 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from right to left instead of left to right as usual, 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

TRUNK
Note: Trunk is worked in spiral. Do not join rnds. Place marker on first st to mark beg of each rnd.
Ch 20. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. 20 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 16 sc.
5th to 7th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 12 sc.
9th to 11th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
12th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 8 sc.
13th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 22" [56 cm]. Fasten off.

EARS
Ch 2.
1st row: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. 8 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. 12 sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to end of row. 16 sc. Do not turn.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working from right to left instead of left to right as usual, 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.

FINISHING
Lightly stuff Trunk. Sew Trunk and Ears to Basket as shown in photo. With smooth black yarn, embroider eyes with satin stitch as shown in photo.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Tangerine (01699) 6 balls or 634 yds/580 m
Contrast B Black (00002) 1 ball or 21 yds/19 m
Contrast C White (00001) 1 ball or 12 yds/11 m
Sizes U.S. J/10 [6 mm] and U.S. K/10½ [6.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 8" [20.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4” [10 cm] with larger hook and 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions:
BASE
With larger hook and 2 strands of A held tog, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc. Do not join. 
Cont working in spiral, placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting. 
3rd rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. 
5th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc. 
6th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc. 
7th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc. 
8th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
9th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 54 sc. 
10th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. 60 sc. 
11th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 66 sc. 
12th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. 72 sc. 
13th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. 78 sc.
14th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. 84 sc.
15th rnd:  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * around. 90 sc.
Note: Base should measure approx 10" [25.5 cm] across. Do not fasten off.
Work side of Basket as follows: 
Ridge rnd:  Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd until side of Basket measures approx 8" [20.5 cm] from Ridge rnd. Join final rnd with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
EARS (make 2)
Noting that sl st join is at center back of Basket, mark center front of Basket top edge. One Ear will be worked on each side of center front (see photo). 
With RS facing, larger hook, join 2 strands of A held tog with sc to top edge of Basket, offset approx. 2" [5 cm] to left of center front. 
1st row: (RS).  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 6 sc.
3rd to 7th rows: As 2nd row. 1 sc remains. Fasten off.
Rep for Second Ear, beg second Ear approx 6" [15 cm] before first Ear noting Ears are spaced approx. 4" [10 cm] apart. 
Inner Ear (make 2) 
With smaller hook and single strand of B, ch 8. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc. 
2nd row:  Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd to 7th rows: As 2nd row. 1 sc remains. Fasten off. 
Sew Inner Ears to Ears as shown in photo.
Nose 
With smaller hook and single strand of C, ch 6. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc. 
2nd row:  Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 4 sc. 
3rd and 4th rows: As 2nd row. 2 sc remain. Fasten off. 
Using back stitch and 2 strands of B, embroider eyes and mouth as shown in photo. 
Using back stitch and single strand of C, embroider whiskers as shown in photo. 
Sew Nose to front of Basket, centered between eyes as shown in photo.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Main Color (MC) White (04005) 1 ball
Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 492 yds/450 m)
Contrast A Misty Gray (86016) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
measurements: Square: Approx 5½" x 5½" x 5½" [14 x 14 x 14 cm]. Rectangular: Approx 5½" x 11" x 5½" [14 x 28 x 14 cm].
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] with MC and larger hook. 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with A and smaller hook.
instructions:
Square Basket
With MC and larger hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 3 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until Basket from marked rnd measures 5½" [14 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Rectangular Basket
With MC and larger hook, ch 17.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 14 ch. 3 ch in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 14 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 34 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 3 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 50 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 58 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 66 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 22 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 22 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 74 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until Basket from marked rnd measures 5½" [14 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Star Applique (make 1 per Basket)
With A and smaller hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 14 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch-3.
2nd rnd: *Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in next ch. Skip next 2 dc. Sl st in next dc. Rep from * around. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Star to Basket as seen in picture.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Main Color (MC) Black (06004) 1 ball
Contrast A Cream (06003) 1 ball
Size U.S. P/16 (11.5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® yarn needle
abbreviations: Bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice all in next stitch. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] wide x 7" [18 cm] tall.
gauge: 6 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 3 strands held tog.
instructions:
Notes:
• Basket is worked with 3 strands held tog throughout.
• Rnds are joined with a sl st to first st.
With MC, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here.

1st rnd (RS):  Ch 1. 10 hdc in ring. Join. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in each st around. Join. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in first st. 2 hdc in next st. *1 hdc in next st. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. *2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each st around. Join. Turn.
Note: 8th, 10th, and 12th rnds are all worked with WS facing (interior of basket) so bobbles face outward.
8th rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Bobble in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around until 2 sts rem. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Join. Turn. Break MC.
9th rnd: (RS).  Join A with sl st to last st of previous rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Turn.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of first 3 sts. Bobble in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. Break A.
11th rnd: Join MC with sl st to last st of previous rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Turn.
12th rnd: As 8th rnd. Break MC.
13th rnd: Join A with sl st to last st of previous rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
14th rnd (RS): Ch 1. 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sts. Ch 6 tightly. Skip next 6 sts. 1 sc in each of next 14 sts. Ch 6 tightly. Skip next 6 sts. Join.
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around, working 8 sc in each ch-6 sp. Join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® Scents (2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Chamomile (24010)  615 m/673 yds or 6 balls
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit round basket 18" [45.5 cm] diameter x 16" [40.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st throughout. Join all rnds with sl st in first st. Beg at bottom, ch 5. Join with sl st to form a ring.  
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 hdc in ring. Join. 8 hdc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 16 hdc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 hdc. 
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 hdc. 
5th rnd: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc. 
Cont inc 8 sts every rnd evenly spaced (as before) until there are 168 hdc (approx 18" [45.5 cm] diameter). 
Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Working in front loops only, 1 dc in each hdc around. Join. Place marker. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each dc around. Join. 
Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc around. Join. 
Rep last 2 rnds until work from marker measures 16" [40.5 cm], ending with sc rnd.
Next rnd: (Openings for handles). Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next sc. Ch 25. Miss next 24 sc.  
1 dc in each of next 60 sc. Ch 25. Miss next 24 sc. 1 dc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st (working 1 sc in each ch) around. 170 sc. Join. 
Proceed in Lace Pat as follows: 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next 3 sc.  
(3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next sc – shell made. Miss next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Miss last sc. Join. 
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3 (counts as hdc and ch 1). 1 hdc in same sp. *Ch 3. 1 sc in top of next Shell. Ch 3. (1 hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc) in next ch-1 sp – v-st made. Rep from * around. Join to 2nd ch of ch 3. 
3rd rnd: Sl st in first ch-1 sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in same sp. *1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Shell in next V-st. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Join to top of ch 3. 
4th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 3. V-st in next ch-1 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in top of next Shell. Rep from * around. Join to first sc. 
5th rnd: Sl st back in last ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 1. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Shell in next V-st. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around, ending with Shell in last V-st. Join to first sc. 
Rep 2nd to 5th rnds for 4" [10 cm], ending with 3rd or 5th rnd. Fasten off. 
Ties (make 8). Ch 15. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. Sew 2 ties at each side of openings (see photo).

materials: Bernat® Maker Outdoor™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 249 yds/228 m)
Contrast A Black (99004) 2 balls
Contrast B Sandy Beach (99002) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 11" [28 cm] tall.
gauge: 15 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
Cont as established, work 8 incs on every rnd, evenly spaced, until there are 144 sc. (18 rnds are complete.)
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of last rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 6" [15 cm]. Join B at end of last rnd.
Break A.
With B, rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 10" [25.5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 29 sc. Ch 14. Skip next 14 sc. 1 sc in each of next 58 sc. Ch 14. Skip next 14 sc. 1 sc in each of next 29 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 29 sc. 17 sc in next ch-14 sp. 1 sc in each of next 58 sc. 17 sc in next ch-12 sp. 1 sc in each of next 29 sc. Join.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off at end of 2nd rnd.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ Tweeds™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 316 yds/289 m) Soft Gray Tweed (11004) 1 ball
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 5" x 10” x 6" [12.5 x 25.5 x15 cm], with top unfolded.
gauge: 11 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
SIDES (make in one piece).
Ch 18. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. Turn. 17 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg 
measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending on 
a WS row. 
**Next row: (RS). (Fold line). Ch 1. 
Working through back loops only, 
1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 1. Working through 
both loops, 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from last 
fold line measures 10" [25.5 cm], 
ending on a WS row.** 
Next row: (RS). (Fold line). Ch 1. 
Working through back loops only, 
1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Next row: Ch 1. Working through 
both loops, 1 sc in each sc to end 
of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from last 
fold line measures 5" [12.5 cm], 
ending on a WS row. Rep from ** 
to ** once more. 
Next row:  (RS). (Joining row). 
Place foundation ch behind last 
row with WS of work tog. Ch 1. 
Working through both thicknesses,
1 sc in each sc to end of row. 
Fasten oﬀ .
BASE 
Ch 28. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. Turn. 27 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row until work from beg 
measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending on 
a WS row. Do not fasten oﬀ . 
Join Base to Sides: Place lower 
edge of Sides behind Base with 
WS of work tog, aligning corners 
of Base with fold lines and joining 
row of Sides. 
Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working 
through both thicknesses, work 
1 rnd of sc around all 4 sides of 
Base. Join with sl st to /f_i  rst sc. 
Fasten oﬀ .
FINISHING 
Fold top edge of Basket to RS as 
shown in picture.

materials: Bernat® Plush™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 146 yds/133 m) Almandine (68056) 2 balls or 240 yds/220 m
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Splsc = Split Single Crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] diameter x 9½" [24 cm] tall, unfolded.
gauge: 8 splsc and 10 rnds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
Cont working in spiral as follows:
2nd rnd: 2 splsc in each sc around. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in next st. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
4th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
5th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
6th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
7th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. 42 sts.
8th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
9th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. 54 sts.
10th to 29th rnds: 1 splsc in each st around.
30th rnd: Ch 14. Skip first 8 sts – Handle made. 1 splsc in each of last 46 sts.
31st rnd: 1 sc in each of first 14 ch. 1 splsc in each of last 46 sts. 60 sc.
32nd and 33rd rnds:  1 splsc in each st around.
Join with sl st in first st. Fasten off.
Hang Basket from Handle, folding upper front edge of Basket down (as shown in photo).

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m; Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Contrast A Ecru (00004) 6 balls or 720 yds/655 m
Contrast B Coral Seas Ombre (02750) 3 balls or 168 yds/153 m
Contrast C Tangerine (01699) 2 balls or 144 yds/131 m
Contrast D Country Red (01530) 2 balls or 132 yds/120 m
Sizes U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) and U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or sizes needed to obtain gauges.
Susan Bates® steel yarn needle.
Susan Bates® stitch marker.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] high.
gauge: Basket: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook and holding 2 strands of yarn together. Toadstool: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook and single strand of yarn.
instructions:
BASKET
Base: With 2 strands of A and larger hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.

6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th to 15th rnds: Cont in this manner, inc 6 sc evenly around each rnd. 90 sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc.
17th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Rep from * around to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 94 sc. Place marker at end of last rnd.
Main Section: Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 94 hdc.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 9½" [24.5 cm]. Join 2 strands of B at end of last rnd. Break A. With 2 strands of B, rep last rnd 3 times more.
Make handles: Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 6 times. *Ch 18. Skip next 18 sps between 2 hdc.* (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 29 times. Rep from * to * once more. **1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from ** around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 6 times. Work 18 hdc in next ch-18 sp. (1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc) 29 times. Work 18 hdc in next ch-18 sp. *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. 94 hdc.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). *1 hdc in sp between next 2 hdc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 hdc in sp between last hdc and first hdc of rnd. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

TOADSTOOL (Make 12)
Toadstool Cap
See diagram on page 3.
With C, ch 16.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. 13 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th to 7th rows: As 2nd row. 5 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3 sts.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Join D.
Edging rnd: With D, ch 1. Work evenly in sc around entire Cap, working 3 sc in each corner sp. Join. Fasten off.

Toadstool Stem
See diagram on page 3.
With D, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd chain from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 7 sc.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 5 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 3 sts.
7th row: As 2nd row.
8th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Join C.
Edging rnd: With C, ch 1. Work in sc evenly around entire Stem, working 3 sc in each corner. Join. Fasten off.

Toadstool Spots
See diagrams on page 3.
Small Spot (make 2)
With D, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join. Fasten off.
Large Spot (make 1)
With D, make magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Sl st in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.
Sew Spots to Toadstool Cap as shown in photo. Align Toadstool Cap and Stem and sew in place as shown in photo.

FINISHING
With D, sew Toadstools evenly, but randomly placed around Main Section of Basket as shown in photo.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Seafoam (04736) 1 ball
Contrast B Baby Blue (04202) 1 ball
Contrast C Misty Gray (04821) 1 ball
Contrast A Orange Flamingo (04800) 1 ball
Contrast B Lavender (04762) 1 ball
Contrast C Baby Pink (04200) 1 ball
Size U.S. M/13 (9 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 6" [15 cm] high.
gauge: 7.5 sc and 7 rows = 4" (10 cm) with 2 strands held together.
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc. 
• When changing colors, do not cut yarn at end of rnd but carry color not in use loosely up WS of work.  
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color

BASKET
With 2 strands of A held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join B.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join A. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd:  With A, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join B. 24 sc.
4th rnd: With B, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join A. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join B. 40 sc.
6th rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join A. 48 sc.
7th rnd: With A, ch 1.  *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join B. 56 sc.
8th rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join A. 64 sc.
9th rnd: With A, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join B. 72 sc.
10th rnd:  With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only,  1 sc in each sc around. Join A. Place marker at end of rnd.
11th rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join B. 
Rep last rnd, alt rnds of A and B, until work from marked rnd measures approx 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a B rnd. 
Next rnd:  With A, ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join 2 strands of C with sl st to first sc. 66 sc.  Break A and B.
Next rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
Next rnd:  Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Turn. 
Next rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Turn.
First Petal: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 2 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 13 sc. 
Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. 11 sc. 
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. 9 sc. 
5th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 5 sc. 
Fasten off. 
Second to Sixth Petals:  With RS facing, join 2 strands of C with sl st to first unworked st of last rnd of Basket. Work 1st to 5th rows as given for First Petal.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ O’Go™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Fired Clay (42008) or Purple Plum (42012) or Agave (42010) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Splsc = Split Single Crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 11¼” [28.5 cm] tall, unfolded.
gauge: 7 splsc and 8.5 rnds = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet. 
• Pull tie to remove. 
• Start crocheting!

CROCHET I SKILL LEVEL: EASY

• If desired, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use.
• Do not join at ends of rnds. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.

Beg with darkest shade (as shown), ch 2.

1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.

Cont working in spiral as follows:
2nd rnd: 2 splsc in each sc around. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in next st. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
4th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
5th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
6th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
7th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. 42 sts.
8th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
9th rnd: *2 splsc in next st. 1 splsc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. 54 sts.
10th to 29th rnds: 1 splsc in each st around.
30th rnd: Ch 14. Skip each of first 8 sts – Handle made. Being careful not to twist chain, 1 splsc in each of last 46 sts.
31st rnd: 1 sc in each of first 14 ch. 1 splsc in each of last 46 sts. 60 sc.
32nd to 33rd rnds: 1 splsc in each st around.
Join with sl st in first st. Fasten off.
Hang Basket from Handle, folding upper front edge of Basket down (as shown in photo).

materials: RED HEART® Cordial™: 3 balls 9949 Cheerful
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5.0mm [US H-8]
Yarn needle
Scissors
Leather scrap: 2” x 6” (5 x 15 cm)
Four ¾” studs or rivets
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Basket measures 11” (28 cm) in diameter x 5½” (14 cm) tall.
gauge: 14 dc = 4” (10 cm); 6 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles/hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
Bottom
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), 14 dc in 3rd ch from hook, join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 15 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in same st, 2 dc in each st around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 30 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st, dc in next st, *2 dc in next st, dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 45 dc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st, dc in each of next 2 sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 60 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in same st, dc in each of next 3 sts, *2 dc in next st, 1 dc in each of next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 75 dc.
Round 6: Ch 3, dc in same st, dc in each of next 4 sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in each of next 4 sts; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 90 dc.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in same st, dc in each of next 5 sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in each of next 5 sts; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 105 dc.
Round 8: Ch 3, dc in same st, dc in each of next 6 sts, *2 dc in next st, dc in each of next 6 sts; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 120 dc.
Rounds 9-11: Ch 1, working in back loop only, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc – 120 sc.
Round 12: Ch 3, working in back loop only, dc in each of the next 2 sts, ch 3, skip next 3 sts, *dc in each of next 3 sts, ch 3, skip next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 60 dc; 20 ch-3 spaces.
Round 13: Ch 3, dc in each of next 2 sts, dc in each of next 3 ch sts, *dc in each of next 3 sts, dc in each of the next 3 ch sts; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 120 dc.
Round 14: Ch 3, dc in each of next 2 sts, ch 3, skip next 3 sts, *dc in each of the next 3 sts, ch 3, skip next 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 60 dc; 20 ch-3 spaces.
Rounds 15–16: Repeat rounds 13–14.
Round 17: Ch 1, *working in back loop only, sc in each of the next 3 sts, sc in each of next 3 ch sts; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 120 sc.
Round 18: Ch 1, working in back loop only, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc – 120 sc.
Round 19: Ch 1, working in back loop only, sc in each st around; join with a slip st in first sc – 120 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
LEATHER HANDLES
Cut leather scrap in 2 pieces, 1” (2.5 cm) wide x 6” (15 cm) long. Round the ends if desired. Poke a hole through each end of the leather pieces, about a ½” (1.3 cm) from each end. Put one stud or rivet through each hole and use them to attach the handles to opposite sides of basket.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ O’Go™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Indigo Fade (42011) 2 O’Gos (Small Version)
Toasted Almond (42004) 2 O’Gos (Large Version)
Size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
measurements: Small: Approx 10½" [26.5 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] high. Large: Approx 13½" [34.5 cm] diameter x 14" [35.5 cm] high.
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Start crocheting!
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 54 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 60 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 66 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 72 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 78 sc.
Large Version only: 14th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 84 sc.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 90 sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 96 sc.
17th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 102 sc.
Both Versions: Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Place marker at end of rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 10 (12)" [25.5 (30.5) cm]. Do not fasten off.
Handles: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 16 (22) sc. Ch 6. Skip next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 33 (45) sc. Ch 6. Skip next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 17 (23) sc. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 16 (22) sc. 10 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in each of next 33 (45) sc. 10 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in each of next 17 (23) sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 86 (110) sc. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver®(7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Aran (0313) 1 ball
Contrast B Turqua (0512) 1 ball
Contrast C Aruba Sea (0505) 1 ball
Contrast D Perfect Pink (0706) 1 ball
Contrast E Shocking Pink (0718) 1 ball
Contrast F Black (0312) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. J/10 (6 mm) and U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needles.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook - Sc2tog made.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 10 sts and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Basket stitch using larger hook and two strands of yarn held together.
instructions:
BASKET
Beginning at center bottom, with two strands of A held together and larger hook, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook, slip st in top of skipped ch-3 – 12 dc (skipped ch-3 counts as dc).
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each dc around, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc] 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 36 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 48 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 60 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, 2 dc in next sc, [dc in next 4 dc, 2 dc in next dc] 11 times, slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 72 dc.
7th rnd: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in same st as join, sc in each dc around, slip st in first sc.
Shape Sides
8th rnd: Ch 1, working in back loops of 6th rnd, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc.
9th rnd: Ch 3, dc in each sc around, slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
10th rnd: Ch 3, 1 dcbp around next 2 dc, 1 dcfp around next 3 dc, [Bpdc around next 3 dc, 1 dcfp around next 3 dc] around, slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
11th rnd: Ch 3, 1 dcfp around next 2 dc, 1 dcbp around next 3 dc, [Fpdc around next 3 dc, 1 dcbp around next 3 dc] around, change to two stands of C held together and slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Cut A.
12th rnd: With C, ch 3 and repeat 10th rnd.
13th rnd: Repeat 11th rnd.
14th to 27th rnds: Repeat 10 to 11 rnds, change to two stands of B held together in last st of last round. Cut C.
28th rnd: With B, repeat 10th rnd.
29th to 30th rnds: Repeat 10th to 11th rnds.
31st rnd: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in each dc around, slip st in first sc.
Shape Handles
32nd rnd: Ch 20, slip st in same st as last slip st, turn, slip st in each of 20 ch just made, slip st in next 35 sc, ch 20, slip st in same sc as last slip st, turn, slip st in each of 20 ch just made, slip st in remaining 35 sc, slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
FLAMINGO
Beak and Head
With smaller hook and one strand of F, ch 2.
1st row: Sc in 2nd ch from hook – 1 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1, 2 sc in sc – 2 sc. Turn.
3rd to 6th rows: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Cut F. Turn.
7th row: Change to E, ch 1, 2 sc in next 2 sc – 4 sc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc – 6 sc. Turn.
9th to 10th rows: Change to D, ch 1, sc in each sc across. Turn.
Shape Neck
11th row: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog – 5 sc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc – 4 sc. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog – 3 sc. Turn.
14th row: Ch 1, sc2tog, 2 sc in next sc. Turn.
15th row: Ch 1, 2 sc in next sc, sc2tog. Turn.
16 to 37th row: Repeat 14th to 15th rows.
38th row: Ch 1, 2 sc in next sc, sc2tog. Turn.
39th row: Ch 1, sc2tog, 2 sc in next sc. Turn.
40th to 47th rows: Repeat 38th to 39th rows. 4 times.
Shape Body
48th row: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across – 6 sc. Turn.
49th row: Ch 1, 2 sc in next sc, sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc – 8 sc. Turn.
50th row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Turn.
51st row: Repeat 49th row – 10 sc.
52th row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Turn.
53th row: Repeat 49th row – 12 sc.
54th to 58th rows: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Turn.
59th row: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog – 10 sc. Turn.
60th row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Turn.
61st row: Repeat 59th row – 8 sc.
62nd row: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 6 sc – 7 sc. Turn.
63rd row: Ch 1, sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog – 6 sc. Turn.
64th row: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog – 5 sc. Turn.
65th row: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, sc in last sc- 3 sc. Turn.
66th row: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in last sc – 2 sc. Turn.
67th row: Ch 1, sc2tog. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
WING
With smaller hook and E, ch 2.
1st row: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 3 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across – 6 sc. Turn.
4th to 6th rows: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc – 5 sc. Turn.
FINISHING
Following photo, sew Wing on Flamingo. With F, embroider a French knot eye on Face. Pin Flamingo in place on front center of Basket and sew in place.
Bent Leg
With F, ch 25. Fasten off.
Straight Leg
With F, ch 20. Fasten off. Position Legs from Body to bottom of Basket and sew in place.

materials: Bernat® Maker Home DecTM (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Small Version: Contrast A and B: 11009 Cream (10468784) 1 ball or 55 yds/50 m
Medium Version: Contrast A 11020 Pacific Varg (10468791) 1 ball or 61 yds/56 m
Contrast B 11009 Cream (10468784) 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Large Version: Contrast A 11006 Steel Blue (10468782) 1 ball or 129 yds/118 m
Contrast B 11009 Cream (10468784) 1 ball or 27 yds/25 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
measurements: Small Version: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] in diameter. Medium Version: Approx 6" [15 cm] in diameter. Large Version: Approx 7" [18 cm] in diameter.
gauge: 17 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
Medium and Large Versions only:
9th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sc.
Large Version only:
11th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 88 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 96 sc.
All Versions: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 3 (4-5) times more.
Medium and Large Versions only: Break A. Join B.
All Versions: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 2 (3-4) times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

materials: Lily ® Sugar ’n Cream ® Scents (56.7 g/ 2 oz) 240 0 1 (Powder) or 240 0 3 (Vanilla Bouquet) 1 ball
Size 3.25 mm (U.S. D or 3) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Fabric stiffener (optional)
measurements: Approx 3 ins [7.5 cm] in diameter x 4 ins [10 cm] tall (unfolded)
gauge: 19 sc and 20 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]
instructions: Ch 4. Join with sl st in ring. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc. 6th rnd: Ch 1. Working through back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 7th rnd: Ch 1. Working through both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Rep last rnd 5 times more. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 44 sc. Work 6 rnds even. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 48 sc. Work 6 rnds even. Fasten off. Optional: Apply Fabric stiffener to container according to manufacturer’s directions.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Red (00095) 2 balls or 156 yds/143 m
Contrast A Mod Green (01223) 1 ball or 29 yds/27 m
Contrast B Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 12 yds/11 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Stitch marker
Yarn needle
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 7½" [19 cm] diameter x 12" [30.5 cm] tall, excluding Hanging Loop.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
Strawberry
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th and alt rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
Cont in same manner, inc 6 sc every alt rnd until there are 78 sc.
24th to 31st rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Dec Section: 1st rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. 72 sts.
2nd and alt rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
3rd rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. 66 sts.
Cont in same manner, dec 6 sc every alt rnd until 48 sts rem.
Next rnd: 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Embroidery: With B, embroider seeds randomly across lower part of Strawberry using straight stitch (as shown in photo).

Leaf (make 2)
With A, ch 12.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. **1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 5 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch.** 3 sc in last ch. Rotate work to cont working along opposite side of foundation ch as follows: skip 1st ch (chain just worked into). Rep from ** to **. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. **1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc.** 2 sc in each of next 3 sc (Base of Leaf). Rep from ** to ** once. 2 sc in next sc. 3 dc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Joining and Hanging Loop: (RS). Join A with sl st through any st along last row of Strawberry. Chain 10" [25.5 cm] (Hanging Loop). Sl st in same sp as last sl st being careful not to twist ch. Fasten off. Feed Hanging Loop from WS to RS through sp between 3rd and 4th sc in Base of each Leaf. Loop knot Hanging Loop, tightening knot to the base of Hanging Loop to secure Leaves in place against Strawberry (as seen in photo).

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Main Color (MC) Soft Peach (06006) - 1 ball or 180 yds/165 m
Contrast A Lichen (06014) - 1 ball or 95 yds/87 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Susan Bates® Split-Lock Stitch Count Marker
Susan Bates® yarn needle
Tape measure
measurements: Small Basket: Approx 4½" [11.5 cm] diameter x 7" [18 cm] unfolded. Large Basket: Approx 6¾" [17 cm] diameter x 9" [23 cm] unfolded.
gauge: 10 single crochet (sc) and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
1st round (rnd): 8 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Join with slip stitch (sl st) to first sc. 8 sc. Insert hook into second ch from hook under the two top loops (do not count loop on hook as a chain); yarn over hook and draw up a loop – 2 loops on hook.

SMALL BASKET
See Diagram on page 6.
Base: With Main Color (MC), make a slip knot and place it on the hook.
Slip Knot
Make a loop with yarn and fold it on itself to make a pretzel shape. Then draw through to make slip knot.
Chain (ch) 2.
Chain
Yarn over hook (yoh), pull through loop – 1 chain made.
Repeat (rep) last step once more – 2 chains made.
Yarn over hook (yoh) and draw through both loops on hook – 1 sc made.
Rep last step 7 times more - 8 sc made.

Slip Stitch
Insert hook into next st. Yoh and draw yarn through both work and loop on hook in one movement.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next sc for corner. 1 sc in next sc. Repeat (rep) from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next sc for corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc and 4 ch-1 spaces (sps).

3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 space (sp). 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.

4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.

5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.

6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Place Marker (PM) at end of rnd. 44 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.

Sides: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. *Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * twice more. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 44 sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 4" [10 cm]. Break MC. Join A with sl st to last st worked.
With A, rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 7" [18 cm]. Fasten off. Fold top 3" [7.5 cm] to Right Side (RS) as seen in picture.

Fasten off
To permanently fasten off yarn, cut yarn leaving a long tail. Pull end of yarn through loop on hook and pull gently to tighten.

STITCH KEY
= chain (ch)
= slip stitch (sl st)
= single crochet (sc)

LARGE BASKET
Base: Rep 1st to 6th rnds as for Small Basket. Do not place marker on 6th rnd.

7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 52 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.

8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next 6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sc and and 4 ch-1 sps.

9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Rep from * twice more. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next 7 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Place Marker (PM) at end of rnd. 68 sc and 4 ch-1 sps.

Sides: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sc. *Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. Rep from * twice more. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 68 sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 6" [15 cm]. Break MC. Join A with sl st to last st worked.
With A, rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 9" [23 cm]. Fasten off. Fold top 3" [7.5 cm] to RS as seen in picture.
