materials: 1 skein of RED HEART® Sweet Home™ in 9785 Calypso
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6 mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Basket measures 6 x 11" (15 x 28 cm) at base and 7" (18 cm) high.
gauge: 10 sc = 4" (10 cm); 8 sc rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BASE
Ch 16.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end, turn – 15 sc.
Rows 2-23: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn. Do not fasten off.

SIDES
Begin working around Base in joined rounds as follows:
Round 1: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 13 sc, 3 sc in next sc, working in edge sts of rows, skip first row, sc in each of next 22 rows, working in unused loops of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each of next 13 ch, 3 sc in next ch, working in edge sts of rows, sc in each of next 22 rows, sc in same st as first sc of this round, join with slip st in first sc – 82 sc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as 1 hdc), working in the back loops only, dc in each of next 15 sc, hdc in next sc, dc in each of next 24 sc, hdc in next sc, dc in each of next 15 sc, hdc in next sc, dc in each of next 24 sc, join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-2.
Rounds 3-6: Ch 2 (counts as 1 hdc), dc in each of next 15 sts, hdc in next hdc, dc in each of next 24 dc, hdc in next hdc, dc in each of next 15 dc, hdc in next hdc, dc in each of next 24 dc, join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-2.
Round 7 (dec round): Slip st in each of next 2 sts, ch 3 (counts as 1 dc), dc in each of next 12 dc, dc3tog over next (dc, hdc, dc), dc in each of next 22 dc, dc3tog over next (dc, hdc, dc), dc in each of next 13 sts, dc3tog over next (dc, hdc, dc), dc in each of next 22 sts, dc3tog over next dc and 2 slip sts, join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-3 – 74 sts.
Round 8: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in each st around, join with slip st in first hdc, turn.

BRIM
Round 9: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each hdc around, join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 10-12: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in all loose ends.

materials: Bernat® Maker Splash™ (8.8 oz /250 g; 305 yds/279 m)
Concrete (35001) or Blue Print (35011) or Teal Print (35010)
1 ball or 210 yds/195 m
Sizes U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® stitch markers.
Susan Bates® yarn needle.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet through back loops only
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm], excluding loop.
gauge: 14.5 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
FIRST SECTION
Ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.  
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 sc. Join 
with sl st to top of ch-3. 6 dc.
Start working in rows as follows:
1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
PM #1 at beg of row. 
Sl st in top of first dc of 2nd rnd to join. Turn. 2 sts (1 sc, 1 sl st).
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in first sl st. Working in back loop, sl st in 
last sc. Turn. 2 sts (1 sc, 1 sl st).
3rd row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl in 
next sc. Sl st in next dc of 2nd rnd to join. Turn. 3 sts 
(1 sl st, 1 sc, 1 sl st).
4th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in first sl st. 1 scbl in next sc. Working in 
back loop, sl st in last sl st. Turn. 3 sts (2 sc, 1 sl st).
5th row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl in 
each of next 2 sc. Sl st in next dc of 2nd rnd to join. Turn. 4 sts 
(1 sl st, 2 sc, 1 sl st).
6th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in first sl st. 1 scbl in each of next 2 sc. 
Working in back loop, sl st in last sl st. Turn. 4 sts (3 sc, 1 sl st).
7th row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl in 
each of next 3 sc. Sl st in same dc of 2nd rnd to join. Turn. 
5 sts (1 sl st, 3 sc, 1 sl st). 
PM #2 on last sl st.
SECOND SECTION
Note: Second Section will be worked over the same number 
of sts (5 sts) without increases after 8th row.
8th row: (WS- inc row). Ch 1. 1 scbl in first sl st. 1 scbl in each 
of next 3 sc. Working in back loop, sl st in last sl st. Turn. 5 sts 
(4 sc, 1 sl st).
9th row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl in 
each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st in next dc of 2nd rnd. Turn. 
10th and alt rows: (WS). Ch 1. Skip first sl st. 1 scbl in each of 
next 4 sc. Working in back loop, sl st in last sl st. Turn. 5 sts.
11th row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl in 
each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st in next dc of 2nd rnd. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl in 
each of next 4 sc. Sl st in same dc of 2nd rnd. Turn. 
15th row: As 11th row. 
PM #3 on last joining sl st. 
4 ridges total for Second Section.
THIRD  SECTION
Note: Third Section will be worked over the same number of 
sts (6 sts) without increases after 16th row. 
16th row: (WS – inc row). Ch 1. 1 scbl in first sl st. 1 scbl in each 
of next 4 sc. Working in back loop, sl st in last sl st. Turn. Total 
6 sts. (5 sc, 1 sl st). 
17th row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl in 
each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st to last dc of 2nd rnd.  Turn. 
18th and alt rows: (WS). Ch 1. Skip first sl st. 1 scbl in each of 
next 5 sc. Working in back loop, sl st in last sl st. Turn. 6 sts.
19th row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl in 
each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st in side of 1st row (where 
placed marker #1). Turn.
21st row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl in 
each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st in sp between next 2 ridges 
(side of 3rd row). Turn.
23rd row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl 
in each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st in same sp as last joining 
sl st. Turn.
25th row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl 
in each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st in sp between next 2 ridges 
(side of 5th row).
27th row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl 
in each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st in sp between next 2 ridges. 
Turn. 
PM #4 on last joining sl st. 6 ridges total for Third Section.
FOURTH  SECTION
Note: Fourth Section will be worked over the same number 
of sts (7 sts) without increases after first increase row 
(28th row of pat) of section.
28h row: (WS – inc row). Ch 1. 1 scbl in first sl st. 1 scbl in 
each sc to last sl st. Working in back loop, sl st in last sl st. 
Turn. 1 sc increased.
29th row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl 
in each sc to end of row. Join with sl st in same sp as last 
joining sl st. Turn.  
30th and alt rows: (WS). Ch 1. Skip first sl st. 1 scbl in each sc 
to last sl st. Working in back loop, sl st in last sl st. Turn. 
The same amount of sts as for 28th rnd.
31st row: Ch 1. Working in back loop, sl st in first sl st. 1 scbl in 
each sc to end of row. Join with sl st in sp between next 
2 ridges. Turn.
33rd row: As 31st row.
34th row: As 30th row.
Rep 29th to 33rd rows once. 6 ridges total for Fourth Section, 
ending on a RS row and PM on last joining sl st. 
Next Section
**Next row: (WS – inc row). As 28th row of Fourth Section. 
Cont in pat as established (alternating 2 ridges in next spot 
with 1 ridge in next spot), rep 29th to 34th rows**. Rep from ** to ** until: 
9 ridges complete for Fifth Section, working over 8 sts, ending 
on a RS row and PM on last joining sl st. 
12 ridges complete for Sixth Section, working over 9 sts, 
ending on a RS row and PM on last joining sl st. 
15 ridges complete for Seventh Section, working over 10 sts, 
ending on a RS row and PM on last joining sl st. 
18 ridges complete for Eighth Section, working over 11 sts, 
ending on a RS row and PM on last joining sl st. 
21 ridges complete for Ninth Section, working over 12 sts, 
ending on a RS row and PM on last joining sl st. 
24 ridges complete for Tenth Section, working over 13 sts, 
ending on a RS row and PM on last joining sl st.
12 ridges complete for Eleventh Section, working over 14 sts, 
ending on WS row. 
Do not fasten off at end of last row.
Hanging loop: Ch 2. Draw up a loop in 2nd ch from hook. PM 
on loop just made. Ch 1. Yoh and draw up a loop through both 
loops on hook – first foundation sc made. *Draw up a loop in 
marked sp. PM on loop just made. Ch 1. Yoh and draw up a 
loop through both loops on hook. Rep from * 11 times more. 
Join with sc to sp where first sc made. Do not fasten off.
Top edging: 1st row: (WS). *Work 1 sc in each sp between next 
2 ridges. Rep from * to last 2 ridges, where last row of last 
section ends.
Note: Top edge will gather slightly to create 3-D shape. 
Do not fasten off.
Spiral Surface sl st: Cont working along joining (spiral) line, 
work surface sl st in each sp between next 2 ridges of sections 
on right side from joining (spiral) line, to end of joining (spiral) 
line (2nd rnd). Fasten off.
Note: Keep sts tight to create inner ridge of spiral.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra Thick™ (21.2 oz/600 g; 72 yds/66 m)
Contrast A Sunny Days (62049) 1 ball
Contrast B Vintage White (62008) 1 ball
Size U.S. Q [16 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] deep x 10" [25.5 cm] tall x 13" [33 cm] wide.
gauge: 4 sc and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
• To change color, work to last 2 
loops on hook and draw new 
color through last 2 loops, then 
proceed in new color.
With A, ch 9.
1st rnd:  4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each of next 6 ch. 4 sc in last 
ch. Do not  turn. Working in rem 
loops of foundation chain. 1 sc in 
each of next 6 ch. Join. 20 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of first 
4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc 
in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of 
next 6 sc. Join. 28 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc 
in next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each of 
next 6 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in 
next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each of 
next 6 sc. Join. 36 sc.
4th rnd: Working in front loops 
only, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. 
Join.
5th to 8th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each 
sc around. Join. Join B at end of 
last rnd. Break A.
9th rnd: With B, as 5th rnd.
10th rnd: (Handles). Ch 1. 1 sc in 
each of first 14 sc. Ch 4. Skip next 
4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Ch 4. 
Skip last 4 sc. Join.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 
14 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 1 sc 
in each of next 14 sc. 1 sc in each 
of next 4 ch. Join. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Plush Big™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 45 yds/41 m)
Main Color (MC) Storm Blue (63003) 2 balls or 89 yds/81 m
Contrast A Buttercup (63027) 1 ball or 27 yds/19 m
Size U.S. Q (16 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® large eye yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] diameter by 8" [20.5 cm] tall when folded.
gauge: 4 sc and 4 rnds = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Note: Join each rnd with sl st to first sc. 
With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Join. 8 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 40 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. Place marker at end of rnd. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in back loop only in each sc around. Join. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 8th rnd until work from marked rnd measures 8" [20.5 cm]. 
Break MC. Join A. 
Rep 8th rnd until work from marked rnd measures 12" [30.5 cm]. 
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra Thick™ (21.2 oz/600 g; 72 yds/66 m)
Version 1 Ice (62002) 2 balls or 144 yds/132 m
Version 2 Aquatic (62028) 2 balls or 144 yds/132 m
Size U.S. Q (16 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] x 10" [25.5 cm] x 10" [25.5 cm] tall because it’s square
gauge: 4 sc and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Ch 11.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm].
Beg working in rnds as follows:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Work 3 sc in corner. Work 10 sc evenly along edge of work. Work 3 sc in corner. Rep from * around. Join. 52 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from first rnd measures 10" [25.5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300g; 220 yds/201 m) Silver Steel (10001) 1 ball or 220 yds/201 m
Sizes U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) and U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
4 st markers.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] diameter x 6" [15 cm] high.
gauge: 9 sc and 10 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
With smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
Cont in same manner, inc 8 sts every rnd until there are 80 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). Working into back loops only, 1 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Place marker at end of rnd.
Proceed in basket weave st pat as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). *Dcfp around next hdc. Dcbp around next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). *Dcbp around next dcfp. Dcfp around next dcbp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
3rd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). *Dcfp around next dcbp. Dcbp around next dcfp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
Rep last 2 rnds for pat until work from marked rnd measures approx 6" [15 cm]. Fasten off.
Handles
Place markers on 1st, 9th, 40th and 49th sts 2 rnds below top edge for 2 Handles.
With larger hook, make 2 chains 16" [40.5 cm] long.
Thread ends of chain from back to front at 1st and 9th marked sts for first handle.
Attach ends of chain tog. Adjust loop to fold in half evenly.
With larger hook, join yarn with sl st at bottom right side of folded loop. Work in sc around both thicknesses of loop to opposite side. Fasten off.
Rep for second Handle at 40th and 49th sts.

materials: Bernat® Mega BulkyTM (10.5 oz/300 g; 64 yds/58 m)
Main Color (MC) Claret (88532) 2 balls
Contrast A Aran (88008) 1 ball
Contrast B Black (88040) 1 ball
Size U.S. S (19 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 sets of hooks and loops fasteners.
4 buttons.
Small amount of Gold (88607).
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Dtr = (Yoh) 4 times. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times - Double treble crochet made.
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] in diameter x 10" [25.5 cm] tall, excluding handles.
gauge: 4 sc and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working through back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Place marker at end of rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Working through both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Join MC. Break A.
With MC, rep last rnd 3 times more. Do not break MC.
With B, rep last rnd twice more. Break B.
With MC, rep last rnd 4 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Arms/handles: (make 2). With MC, ch 6. Join with sl st in first ch to form rnd, placing marker on first st.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 6" [15 cm]. Join B. Break MC.
Mitten: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: (Thumb). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 dtr in next sc. Push post to RS of work for thumb. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th and 6th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st to first st. 4 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Join with sl st to first st. 2 sts. Fasten off.
Sew Arms at sides of Basket, securing with buttons through all thicknesses. Sew hooks and loops fasteners to mittens and front of Basket.
With Gold, embroider buckle with chain stitch to front of Basket as illustrated.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 400 Gray Heather A and 1 skein 726 Coral B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8mm [US L-11]
Yarn needle
Stitch marker
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Basket measures 7½” (19 cm) high x 13½” (34.5 cm) diameter across bottom.
gauge: Rounds 1–5 = 4¼” (11 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With 3 strands of A held together, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join; place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—30 sc.
Round 6: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—40 sc.
Round 7: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—48 sc.
Round 8: *Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—56 sc.
Round 9: *Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—64 sc.
Round 10: *Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—72 sc.
Round 11: *Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—80 sc.
Round 12: *Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—88 sc.
Round 13: *Sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—96 sc.
Round 14: *Sc in next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—104 sc.
Round 15: [Sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times, remove marker, sc in next 6 sc, slip st in next sc.
Round 16: Working in back loops only, sc in next 112 sc—112 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 17–19: Working in both loops, sc in each sc around; drop and cut 1 strand of A at end of Round 19, leaving an 8” (20.5 cm) tail. Pick up 1 strand of B.
Round 20: With 2 strands of A and 1 strand of B held together, sc in each sc around.
Round 21: *Sc in next 26 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—108 sc.
Rounds 22 and 23: Sc in each sc around; drop and cut 1 strand of A at end of Round 23, leaving an 8” (20.5 cm) tail. Pick up 1 strand of B.
Round 24: With 1 strand of A and 2 strands of B held together, sc in each sc around.
Round 25: *Sc in next 25 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—104 sc.
Rounds 26 and 27: Repeat Rounds 22 and 23.
Round 28: With 3 strands of B held together, sc in each sc around.
Round 29: *Sc in next 24 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—100 sc.
Rounds 30 and 31: Sc in each sc around.
Round 32: Slip st in each sc around.
Round 33: Working in front loops only, slip st in each slip st around.
Round 34: Working in both loops, slip st in each slip st around; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
FINISHING: With right side facing and holding 3 strands together, join A with slip st in any unworked loop of Round 16, slip st in each unworked loop around; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Chunky™: 4 skeins 400 Grey Heather A, 1 skein 341 Light Grey B, and small amounts of 373 Petal Pink C, and 312 Black D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 6.5mm [US K-10½] and 8mm [US L-11]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, B, C, etc.
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Basket measures about 10" [25.5 cm] high, 12" [30.5 cm] wide and 36" [91.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: 9 sc = about 4" [10 cm]; 10 rows = about 4" [10 cm] with larger hook and 2 strands of yarn held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BASKET BASE
With larger hook and 2 strands of A held together, ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc.
Place a marker in last sc of Round 1 to mark end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around, do not join with slip st in first sc, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—12 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 7: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 8: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 9: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] 6 times—54 sc.
Round 10: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts] 6 times—60 sc.
Round 11: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts] 6 times—66 sc.
Round 12: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts] 6 times—72 sc.
Round 13: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 11 sts] 6 times—78 sc.
Fasten off. Base should measure about 12" [30.5 cm] across.

BASKET SIDES
With larger hook and 2 strands of A held together, ch 24.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—23 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Repeat last row until piece measures about 36" [91.5 cm] from beginning (or length needed to reach comfortably all the way around outer edge of basket base).
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew short edges of basket sides together to form a tube. Sew one edge of tube to basket base.

Ears (make 2)
Place the side seam at the back of the basket and find the center of the top edge. One ear will be worked on each side of the center of top edge of basket.
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, larger hook, and 2 strands of A held together, join yarn with an sc to top edge of basket, about 2" [5 cm] past center top, work 6 more sc along top edge of basket—7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each st across—6 sc.
Rows 3–6: Repeat Row 2 for 4 more times—2 sc in Row 6.
Fasten off. Repeat to work 2nd ear, beginning the ear about 5½-6" [14-15 cm] before the first ear so that the finished ears are about 4" [10 cm] apart.

Inner Ear (make 2)
With smaller hook and one strand of B, ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each remaining ch across—7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each st across—6 sc.
Rows 3–6: Repeat Row 2 for 4 more times—2 sc in Row 6.
Fasten off.

Nose
With smaller hook and one strand of C, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each remaining ch across—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc2tog, sc in each st across—4 sc.
Rows 3 and 4: Repeat Row 2 twice—2 sc in Row 4.
Fasten off.

Sew one inner ear to front of each ear. Sew nose to front of basket, centered between ears and 2-3" [5-7.5 cm] below top edge.

Facial features: Use photograph as a guide. With 2 strands of D, embroider straight stitch eyes and mouth.
With 2 strands of B, embroider straight stitch whiskers.
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Hot Green (01712) 2 balls or 210 yds/192 m
Contrast B Robin’s Egg (01215) 1 ball or 42 yds/38.5 m
Contrast C Country Yellow (01612) 1 ball or 42 yds/38.5 m
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 6 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 6 dc group. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
measurements: Approx 5½" [14 cm] diameter x 7" [18 cm] tall.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: • All rnds are joined with sl st to first sc.
• Picots do not count as sts; they are worked between sc and are not worked into in subsequent rnds.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
10th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
11th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 66 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
13th rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join.
14th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Rep 14th rnd until Basket measures 3" [7.5 cm] deep.
Beg working Tulip Pat as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd and 3rd ch from hook – picot made. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Picot. Rep from * around. Join. Break A. Join B.
2nd rnd: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). Skip first sc. *Popcorn in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Ch 2. Popcorn in next sc. Ch 1. Join to 3rd ch of ch-4. Break B. Join A.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in ch-1 sp. 1 sc in popcorn. *2 sc in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in next popcorn. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last ch-1 sp. Join.
4th to 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
9th rnd: As 1st rnd. Break A. Join C.
10th rnd:  As 2nd rnd. Break C. Join A.
11th to 16th rnds: With A, as 3rd to 8th rnds.
Rep 1st to 12th rnds once more. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Bunches of Hugs™: 2 balls 5311 Chalk A and 1 ball 6358 Fairy Tale B
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 8mm [US L-11]
Yarn needle
smaller crochet hook for fringe
4" (10 cm) square of heavy cardboard (optional)
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Basket measures 42" circumference x 14" tall (106.68 x 35.5 cm)
gauge: 8 sc = 4" (10 cm); 10 rows = 4" (10 cm) with 4 strands held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With 4 strands of A held together, ch 3; join with slip st in first ch to for a ring. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed. 
Work in continuous rounds, do not join until instructed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: *2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around—24 sc. 
Round 5: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around—30 sc. 
Round 6: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * around—36 sc. 
Round 7: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * around—42 sc. 
Round 8: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts; repeat from * around—48 sc. 
Round 9: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts; repeat from * around—54 sc. 
Round 10: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts; repeat from * around—60 sc. 
Round 11: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts; repeat from * around—66 sc. 
Round 12: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts; repeat from * around—72 sc.
Round 13: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 11 sts; repeat from * around—78 sc. 
Round 14: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 12 sts; repeat from * around—84 sc. 
Round 15: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around.
Rounds 16–21: Sc in each st around.
Round 22: *Sc in next 6 sc, sc in back loop of next 6 sc; repeat from * around. 
Rounds 23–26: Sc in each st around.
Round 27: *Sc in back loop of next 6 sc, sc in next 6 sc; repeat from * around.
Rounds 28–31: Sc in each st around.
Rounds 32–41: Repeat Rounds 22–31.
Round 42: Repeat Round 22.
Rounds 43 and 44: Sc in each st around.
Round 45: Sc in next 14 sts, ch 16 (handle), skip next 14 sts, sc in next 28 sts, ch 16 (handle), skip next 14 sts, sc in last 14 sc—56 sc and 2 ch-16 spaces.
Round 46: *Sc in each st around to next ch-16 space, 16 sc in next ch-16 space; repeat from * around, sc in each remaining st—88 sc.
Rounds 47–49: Sc in each st around; at end of last round, join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Fringes
Cut 210 strands of B, each 8" (20.5 cm) long. Wrap yarn around 4" (10 cm) cardboard square multiple times, cut across lower edge; repeat until 210 strands have been cut.
Fold strand in half to form a loop. Insert smaller crochet hook in any unworked front loop of Round 21. Place fold on hook and draw fold through, forming a loop. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten. Repeat to attach fringe in each unworked front loop of Rounds 21, 26, 31, 36, and 41. Trim ends evenly to 2½" (6.5 cm).

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Main Color (MC) Coffee (0365) 1 ball
Contrast A Café Latte (0360) 1 ball
Contrast B Hot Red (0390) 1 ball
Contrast C Soft White (0316) 1 ball
Contrast D Black (0312) 1 ball
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
Yarn needle.
Stuffing for Nose.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Twisted sc = Insert hook in next stitch. Bring hook over yarn instead of yarn over hook and pull up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 9½" [24 cm] diameter x 7" [18 cm] tall, excluding antlers and nose
gauge: 16 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook and 1 strand of yarn. 10½ twisted sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger crochet hook and 2 strands of yarn.
instructions:
BASKET
Notes:
• Basket is worked with 2 strands of yarn. 
• Antlers, Nose and Eyes are worked with 1 strand of yarn. 
• Join each rnd with sl st to first sc. 
With 2 strands of A and larger hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join. 40 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join. 48 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join. 56 sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join. 64 sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Join. 72 sc. 
10th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join 2 strands of MC. 80 sc. Break A. 
11th rnd: With 2 strands of MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. PM at end of rnd. 
12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 twisted sc in each sc around. Join. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 7” [18 cm]. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from right to left instead of left to right as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

REINDEER ANTLERS (make 2). 
With A and smaller hook, ch 14. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 
**2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
Rep last rnd 10 times more. 
Shape Side Antler: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 
Rep last rnd until there are 24 sc. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 12 sc. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join. 14 sc. 
Next 6 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
Shape top of Side Antler: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 10 sts. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. Join. 5 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread yarn through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. 
Main Antler: Join A with sl st to rem loops of ch-2. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in rem loops of ch-2. 1 sc in each skipped sc around. Join. 14 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. ** 
Rep from ** to ** once more. 
Rep last rnd 5 times more. 
Shape top of Main Antler: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 10 sts. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. Join. 5 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread yarn through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. 
Following diagram on page 3, sew Reindeer Antlers to inside of Basket.

EARS (make 2)
With MC and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join. 9 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join. 12 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join. 15 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join. 18 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join. 21 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join. 24 sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join. 27 sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. PM at end of last rnd. 
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 3” [7.5 cm]. Next rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 9 times. Join. 18 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. 
Do not stuff.

NOSE
With B and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th to 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread yarn through sts of last rnd. Pull slightly. Stuff lightly and sew Nose in position.

EYES
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc. Fasten off D.
4th rnd: (RS). Join C with sl st to back loop of any sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off. 
Using satin stitch, with C, embroider White Dot on each eye (see diagram). Sew Eyes in position.

pattern_name: Stitch Club Color Block Crochet Basket
materials: Patons® Shetland Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 143 yds/131 m)
Contrast A Oxford Gray (78046) 4 balls
Contrast B Charcoal (78042) 2 balls
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
1 stitch marker.
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] diameter x 9 1/2" [24 cm] high.
gauge: 10 sc and 10 rows = 4" with 2 strands of yarn held tog.
instructions:
Note:  Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
With 2 strands of A held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd:  8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 64 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Place marker at end of rnd
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 6" [16 cm]. 
Join 2 strands of B at end of last rnd. With 2 strands of B held tog, rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 9 1/2" [24 cm]. 
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 97 yds/87 m) Burgundy Plum (27005) 2 balls
Size U.S. P/Q (15 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
abbreviations: Shallow sc = Insert hook between 2 strands of vertical V in the middle of sc instead of usual way. Draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 13½" [34.5 cm] diameter x 14" [35.5 cm] high.
gauge: 4 sc and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 48 sc. Cont in same manner, inc 6 sts every rnd until work measures 13½" [34.5 cm] in diameter. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working into back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. PM at end of rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 Shadow sc in each st around. Join with sl st in first st. Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 12" [30.5 cm]. Do not fasten off.
Handles
Place marker at each side of Basket. 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 Shadow sc in each st to 6 sts before marker. Ch 6.* Skip next 6 sts. Rep from * to * once. Join with sl st in first st.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 Shadow sc in each st to next ch-6 sp. 8 sc in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * once more. Join with sl st to first stc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 Shadow sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra ™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 97 yds/87 m) Pinky Punk (27074) 2 balls
Size U.S. N/15 (10 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] diameter x 10" [25.5 cm] high.
gauge: 8 sl sts and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: For Bottom: join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Bottom: Ch 2.
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 21 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 28 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 35 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 42 sc.
Cont in same manner, inc 7 sc every rnd until work measures 15" [38 cm] in diameter.
Final bottom rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Side
Note: For Side do not join in rnds. Work in spiral. Move marker for beg of rnd as work progresses.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Sl st in back loop of each st around. Do not join.
Rep last rnd until work from final bottom rnd measures 10" [25.5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz /70.9 oz; 120 yds/109 m)
Small White (00001) or Emerald (00062) 2 balls
Medium Red (00095) 3 balls
Size U.S. E or 4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Optional: Fabric stiffener
measurements: Small: Approx 5 x 5 x 6 " [12.5 x 12.5 x 15 cm], with top unfolded. Medium: Approx 5 x 10 x 6" [12.5 x 25.5 x 15 cm], with top unfolded.
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: The instructions are written for small basket. If changes are necessary for medium basket the instructions will be written thus ( ). SIDES Ch 28. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 27 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 5"[12.5 cm], ending with a WS row. Small Basket only: **Next row: (RS). (Fold line). Ch 1. Working through back loops only, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Next row: Ch 1. Working through both loops, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Rep last row until work from last fold line measures 5"[12.5 cm], ending with a WS row.** Rep from ** to ** twice more. Medium Basket only: Next row: (RS). (Fold line). Ch 1. Working through back loops only, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. ***Next row: Ch 1. Working through both loops, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Rep last row until work from last fold line measures 10"[25.5 cm], ending with a WS row.*** Next row: (RS). (Fold line). Ch 1. Working through back loops only, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Next row: Ch 1. Working through both loops, 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Rep last row until work from last fold line measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending with a WS row. Rep from *** to *** once more. Both Baskets: Next row: (RS). (Joining row). Place foundation ch behind last row with WS of work tog. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc across. Fasten off. BASE Ch 23 (46). 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 22 (45) sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. Rep last row until work from beg measures 5"[12.5 cm], ending with a WS row. Do not fasten off. Join Base to Sides: Place lower edge of Sides behind Base with WS of work tog, aligning corners of Base with fold lines and joining row of Sides. Next rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc around all 4 sides of Base. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off. FINISHING Fold top edge to RS as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver Stripes™: 3(6, 6) skeins 4971 Retro Stripe
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.5mm [US K-10.5]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Small basket measures about 8" [20.5 cm] tall and 30" [76 cm] circumference. Medium basket measures about 10" [25.5 cm] and 36" [91.5 cm] circumference. Large basket measures about 12" [30.5 cm] and 42" [106.5 cm] circumference.
gauge: 8 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 9½ rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet with 3 strands of yarn held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BASKET
Base
With 3 strands of yarn held together, ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—54 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc.
Medium Basket Only:
Round 11: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—66 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc.
Large Basket Only:
Round 11: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—66 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 11 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—78 sc.
Round 14: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 12 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—84 sc.
Sides
All Baskets:
Next Round (right side): Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—60 (72, 84) sc.
Next 15(20,25) Rounds: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Handles
Next Round: Ch 1, sc in first 10 (12, 14) sts, ch 10 (12, 14), skip next 10 (12, 14) sts, sc in next 20 (24, 28) sts, ch 10 (12, 14) sts, skip next 10 (12, 14) sts, sc in last 10 (12, 14) sts; join with slip st in first sc—40 (48, 56) sc and 2 ch-10 (12, 14) spaces.
Next Round: Ch 1, [sc in each st to next ch-space, 10 (12, 14) sc in ch-space] twice, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Last Round: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Jute (00082) 3 balls or 310 yds/283.5 m
Contrast B Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 55 yds/50 m
Contrast C Rose Pink (00046) 1 ball or 50 yds/46.5 m
Sizes U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) and 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Stitch marker.
1 pair of 6 mm plastic safety eyes.
Tapestry needle.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 5" x 7" [12.5 x 18 cm], excluding ears.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook, holding 2 strands of yarn tog.
instructions:
Note: Rnds are joined with sl st to first sc. With larger hook and 2 strands of A held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th to 10th rnds: Cont in this manner, inc 6 sc evenly around each rnd. 60 sc at end of 10th rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Place marker at end of last rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 8" [20.5 cm]. Fasten oﬀ.
Inner Ears (make 2)
With smaller hook and single strand of C, ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 10 sc.
6th to 8th rows: As 2nd to 4th rows.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sc.
Rep 9th row until work from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm] from beg. 
Shape top: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
3rd to 5th rows: As 1st row. 4 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 2 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Do not fasten oﬀ.
Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Inner Ears. Join. Fasten oﬀ.
Outer Ears (make 2) 
With smaller hook and single strand of A, ch 14.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 13 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 14 sc.
6th to 8th rows: As 2nd to 4th rows.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 16 sc.
Rep 9th row until work from beg measures 3½" [9 cm]. 
Shape top: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 14 sc.
Rep 1st row 5 times more. 4 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 2 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Do not fasten oﬀ.
Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Outer Ears. Join. Fasten oﬀ.
Stitch Inner Ears to Outer Ears as shown in photo.
Nose
With C and smaller hook, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten oﬀ.
Fold brim of Basket over as shown in photo, allowing for 2½" [6.5 cm] overlap. Sew Nose in position and attach safety eyes to Basket as shown in photo.
Work whiskers in B in Chain St as shown in photo. Sew Ears to Basket.
Pompom
Wind B around 4 fingers approx 60 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to smooth round shape. Attach pompom to back of Basket at base.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Robin’s Egg (01215) or
Rose Pink (00046) or
Hot Purple (01317) 2 balls or 166 yds/152 m per Basket
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Yarn needle.
measurements: Approx 6" in diameter x 6" tall [15 x 15 cm]
gauge: 18 sc and 20 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note:  Join all rnds with sl st to first sc unless otherwise indicated.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
10th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
11th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 66 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 78 sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 84 sc.
15th rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join.
16th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Rep 16th rnd until Basket measures 5" [12.5 cm] deep.
Next rnd:  Ch 4. *Skip next 2 sts. Sl st in next st. Ch 4. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first ch of ch-4.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *4 sc in next ch-4 sp. 2 sc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 4. Turn. Skip next 3 sc. Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. Turn. (1 sc. Ch 3. 2 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) all in ch-4 sp just made. 2 sc in ch-4 sp from prev rnd. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Ora™: 15 balls 5341 Pietra A, and 9 balls 5360 Caramello B.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 10mm [US J-6]
Yarn needle.
measurements: Large basket measures about 10” [25.5 cm] wide, 15½” [39.5 cm] long, and 12” [30.5 cm] tall. Small basket measures about 7” [18 cm] wide, 11½” [29 cm] long, and 9” [23 cm] tall.
gauge: 7 sts = about 4” [10 cm]; 9 rows = about 4¼” [11 cm] in single crochet (sc). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LARGE BASKET
BASE
With A, ch 28.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—27 sc.
Rows 2–21: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off.
LONG SIDE (make 2)
With A, ch 28.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—27 sc.
Rows 2–21: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Make Opening for Handle
Row 22: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 9 sc, ch 9, skip next 9 sc, sc in last 9 sc—18 sc and 1 ch-9.
Row 23: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc and ch across—27 sc.
Rows 24 and 25: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off. Repeat for second long side.
SHORT SIDE (make 2)
With A, ch 19.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—18 sc.
Rows 2–25: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off.
SMALL BASKET
BASE
With B, ch 21.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—20 sc.
Rows 2–15: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off.
LONG SIDE (make 2)
With A, ch 21.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—20 sc.
Rows 2–15: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Make Opening for Handle
Row 16: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 7 sc, ch 6, skip next 6 sc, sc in last 7 sc—14 sc and 1 ch-6.
Row 17: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc and ch across—20 sc.
Rows 18 and 19: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off. Repeat for second long side.
SHORT SIDE (make 2)
With A, ch 14.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—13 sc.
Rows 2–19: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Attach long sides to base: Hold base and one long side together, with stitches along edge matching. Working from right side (outside of basket) and through both thicknesses, join yarn with a slip st in beginning corner, slip st in each st across to opposite corner. Fasten off. Repeat to attach second long side to remaining long side of base.
Attach short sides to base: Hold base and one short side together, with stitch along edge matching. Working from right side and through both thicknesses, join yarn with a slip st in beginning corner, slip st evenly spaced across to opposite corner. Fasten off. Repeat to attach second short side to remaining short side of base.
Join basket corners: Working from right side and through both thicknesses, join yarn with a slip st at beginning of any basket corner edge, working through both thicknesses, slip st evenly spaced along edge. Fasten off. Repeat to join remaining three basket corners.
Weave in ends.
